locations.title: SA Aquatic and Leisure Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà443 Morphett Rd, Oaklands Park SA 5046

showerReviews.reviewText:
Just visited the Marion Swimming Centre today, hoping to spend our last day here undercover and enjoying some family fun. We were charged full price on entry, only to discover that the only area open to the public was the small kiddie pool.

One very disappointed 8-year-old‚Ä¶ and honestly, the adults weren‚Äôt impressed either.

If full price is being charged, there really should be clear signage or public access times listed so families know what‚Äôs actually available before paying. We didn‚Äôt ask for a refund because we didn‚Äôt want to cause a scene, but we definitely left feeling let down.

Unfortunately, we won‚Äôt be back ‚Äî but we hope this feedback helps improve transparency for other families.
showerReviews.author: Cherie Billing

showerReviews.reviewText: We held our daughter‚Äôs 5th birthday yesterday and it was absolutely amazing - our hosts were Ethan and Indie and they were smiling, patient, courteous and attentive and definitely an asset to waterworld! Being our first time we were not sure what to to expect -we booked for 15 kids and they got a lovely private area of the pool for games.  Everything went smoothly, and despite having a few alterations to plans they were super accommodating and also being Australia Day a super busy day where if not staffed appropriately I could see things getting missed or being a little all over the shop but that did not happen at all and none of the staff looked one bit stressed! Thankyou so much for making our daughters birthday one to remember the kids had a wonderful time playing games, swimming, eating and enjoying the sunshine! Also shoutout to Martina the coordinator who was seemless and professional to deal with from start to finish! All round 5 stars team üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü
showerReviews.author: Meaalofa Tolovae

locations.title: The ARC Campbelltown
locations.address: ÓÉà531 Lower North East Rd, Campbelltown SA 5074

showerReviews.reviewText:
I sent my child to come here to play volleyball on last Thursday. It was my first time visiting this sports centre and I was a bit shocked by the scale of this sports complex in South Australia.

I lived in Sydney for a few years before relocation to SA, I don't think there is any community sports complex has similar scale comparable to this ARC Compbelltown (except the Olympic Park which was used for 2000 Olympic games).

They have swimming pools, gym room, squash courts (5 nos.), multi-purpose sports courts (5 nos.), and community meeting rooms etc. There is a small cafe too. I love to see so many people especially the young generations love doing exercises in this huge sports centre. I will encourage my child to come here more often to do more exercises in this sports centreüëç
showerReviews.author: Pat Chung

locations.title: Salisbury Aquatic Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàHappy Home Dr, Salisbury North SA 5108

showerReviews.reviewText:
Overall, the hardware design is excellent. It features both indoor and outdoor pools, along with three fantastic water slides and a very comprehensive splash park area.

However, the "software" and amenities fall short of expectations. The caf√© area is far too small, with seating for only four tables. Additionally, the hygiene standards in the restrooms and changing areas are quite disappointing. In the grassy areas, shaded pavilions and tree cover are very limited, making it difficult to find a spot to rest during hot weather.

Most importantly, while the facility is new, the construction quality is surprisingly rough. For instance, the black metal strips on the outdoor concrete steps are actually coming loose; once detached, they leave sharp corners that pose a serious risk to barefoot visitors. The blue water slide has visible gaps and leaks severely. Furthermore, on a curve of the blue slide near the ground, the structure shakes vertically when anyone over 50kg slides through, suggesting a lack of necessary structural support. Lastly, the plastic on the green water slide is already showing signs of aging, indicating that the quality of this slide needs significant improvement.
showerReviews.author: April GUAN

showerReviews.reviewText:
Please for the love of god re-contract the cafe to someone who knows how to run one.

The swimming centre itself is lovely, so it‚Äôs a real shame that our day was soured by the shockingly slow service at the cafe. 45+ mins wait for hot food and then we received wedges instead of chips. We even ordered a pre-made sandwich and donut and that took 5 mins for her to finally put it in a bag and hand it over.

When the cafe is run properly I will happily give more stars.
showerReviews.author: Nat Ahrens

showerReviews.reviewText: Visited Saturday 11th October 2025 with between 40 to 50 pax for 2 birthday parties. Just off waterloo corner road, very impressed with the new Salisbury Aquatic Centre facilities replacing the old Aquatic centre.  I believe there are 3 swimming pools. Two heated indoors and a larger outdoor swimming pool. Also a waterpark for the kids with the slides and tipping water bucket. Also a decent sized gym. Plenty of life savers patrolling the areas which gives a feeling of better security and safety. A number of outside shaded areas with tables also adds to the enjoyment. Also a large grassy area if you want to rest there.  Plenty of carparks too, except maybe on the hottest busiest holiday times. Also a cafeteria  and modern showers, changerooms and toilets too. We were allowed to bring our own portable chairs and tables and food in the  area next to the outside pool which was very helpful and appreciated.  Cost for the kids around $7.20 each. So rather inexpensive compared to some other establishments we have been to. Also a no alcohol policy. Was going to take some videos and photos but they also have a no taking images of other kids except your own which is fair enough. A big improvement from the old swimming centre and well worth checking out.
showerReviews.author: Darren Adams

showerReviews.reviewText: Beautiful location set amongst old eucalyptus trees with lots of grass area for sitting. Good facilities, change rooms, restrooms, kiosk, and 3 pools for different ages. showerReviews.reviewText:
Outdoor pools, beautifully nestled amongst lots of lawn and trees, plenty of natural shade and shaded areas.
Car park is a long long long walk away, and entrance was inconveniently really hard to find for the first visit.
The offer several seating areas and a bbq facility.
I love that the kiosk is not so far from the toddler splash/play area.
The splash & water play area for the little ones are fun but not so keen on constantly have to share the toddler pool with the ducks.
The toilets & showers are kept clean.
showerReviews.author: Janet‚Äôs Journey

showerReviews.reviewText: George Bolton Swimming Centre is a great outdoor swimming place in summer. It is located in Hazelwood Park Reserve. Three pools for people of different ages and levels. The lifeguards here are professional and attentive. Many old gum trees and lawns for rest and picnic. There are also a barbecue area and some children's play facilities. Food and drinks are available at Hazel's poolside cafe. The toilets and shower rooms are large and clean, with some family rooms.
showerReviews.author: Lu Liu

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great pool surrounded by trees and beautiful grass land.
They have a 50m pool for a good lap swimming and plenty of pool for kids to play. The kids pool is 0.7m deep and heated so my 3 year old really enjoyed as she can reach the bottom. The grass area has lots of shade and it is perfect for a picnic but the cafe in the swimming center is actually very good to if you want to eat there.
Is AUD8.5 per adult to go in and AUD7.5 for kids over 4....under 4 is free.
The life guards are there to supervise the parents more than anything...they are always going after the parent that blinks their eyes while their kid is in the pool....fair enough...but I wish they could also be more in charge of the people in the pool like any other pool in the world....
Overall beautiful place to relax and play.
showerReviews.author: Janaina Carvalho Lopes

showerReviews.reviewText: Such a fantastic and mostly warm chlorine pool for hydrotherapy or swimming with gradual shallow (0.8m) to deep (1.65m) water levels, which is great for all leg/arm exercises and very relaxing for painful backs injuries. Wide railed ramp access with mobile wheelchairs available. Only complaint, it has only one disabled bathroom, really needs to be more to cater for the disabled. A separate male and female open shower/toilet/changerooms. Would be such a pity if this community pool ever closes, as the temperature (~33¬∞) and water depths are not available nearby.
showerReviews.author: Carolyn

locations.title: Norwood Swimming Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà32 Phillips St, Kensington SA 5068

showerReviews.reviewText: Norwood pool is wonderful.There is a lot of rubbish in some of these reviews! The staff are super friendly and great with kids, the bathrooms and well cleaned and looked after with hot showers. The pool is lovely and warm and the gardens are pretty with huge gum trees. If you buy a 20 pass you get great value for entry and children's swim lessons also include a free swim all that day for the child doing lessons. It is a great local pool that runs movie nights with free popcorn and Summer fun events. A safe and beautiful place. Bbq upon request. Full size pool and toddler/ children's pool and green lawns. I really don't know why anyone would complain about this place. It's beautiful.
showerReviews.author: Jasmine Brooks

showerReviews.reviewText: One of Adelaide‚Äôs best outdoor pools! Beautiful setting with large, shady gumtrees and thick, green grass. The old-style change rooms are serviceable but could do with some updates in keeping with the period they were built. The main pool goes very deep at one end and is quite shallow at the other. However, the old filter system really pushes water through the vents which can sometimes interfere with any lap swimming, particularly breaststroke. As outdoor pools go, this one is generally very quiet, so don‚Äôt tell too many people about it!
showerReviews.author: Bilik Finke

showerReviews.reviewText:
**Subject: Disappointing Policy for Families with Disabilities**

My son, who has a disability and requires the assistance of two carers, absolutely loves swimming. We found Paragon Swimming Centre at 97/99 Smart Rd, Modbury, to be a great facility in terms of the pool and general environment.

However, there's a significant drawback that makes it unsuitable for families like mine. This centre does not accept the Companion Card because they are a non-government business. This policy means that both of my son's essential carers are required to pay an entry fee.

This creates a real financial barrier. If the support workers cannot afford the extra cost, or if it becomes too much of a burden for us to cover, my son misses out on an activity he dearly loves and benefits from.

From a disability access and inclusion perspective, this is a major issue. While the physical facility is good, the lack of acceptance for the Companion Card makes it a difficult and potentially unaffordable option for those who rely on carers for support. Families needing to use a Companion Card may need to seek out other swimming centres that have a more inclusive policy. This has been a very disappointing aspect of our experience.
showerReviews.author: Lily

showerReviews.reviewText:
This is our local pool, and we have visited the business for years without any issues.

On the 20th Oct 2024 my wife and daughter had a problem with a staff member unnecessarily causing an unsafe situation (turning off lights in the changing room as my family was taking too long to get changed -- to be exact, 4 minutes after closing time).

I have discussed the matter with the management. The owner was polite, communicated promptly, offered apologies and assured that disciplinary action had been taken.

The owner and I are not aligned on what would be adequate compensation for the incident (which is fine, disagreements happen) and as such we've decided to leave it at that and go swimming elsewhere.

I would give Paragon 4 stars for our experience prior to the incident and 1 star for the experience relating to the incident. 3 stars overall.

I have reported facts only, not personal opinions.
showerReviews.author: Matteo Rizzi

showerReviews.reviewText:
Had a membership mostly for the pool and didnt use it. Then I learned there is Acqua fitness classes.
Joining these means I now attend as there is a structure.
This gave me the enthusiasm and routine I needed to book and do lap swimming.
Now I alternate swimming laps with the classes and I am feeling so much better mentally and physically.
I have paid for some one to one personal training so that I can learn how to use the gym equipment correctly and the trainer understood my physical limitations and took that into account.

It's a very relaxed place where people, staff and customers are friendly and not overbearing .

showerReviews.reviewText:
Excellent club, great facilities and great staff especially in the tennis field. Strongly recommend for an executive-like atmosphere.

Special props to tennis coaches Luke and Joel, extremely welcoming and very professional and supportive of my tennis endeavours, having both had a professional background in the sport.

Cafe staff are extremely polite and friendly with customers. Meals are high quality and are delivered at seriously fast times -  no waiting around with these guys.

The pool facilities aren‚Äôt like any other in Adelaide. Highly maintained and very clean, swimming instructors are very good and produce excellent swimmers.

Gym facilities are top notch (as expected from such a world class club. Enough equipment to rival the best gyms across Australia. Staff are welcoming and encouraging towards clients.

Overall a very special experience every visit and would strongly recommend for anyone to attend.

locations.address: ÓÉà7/127 Rundle Mall, Adelaide SA 5000

showerReviews.reviewText:
Under the new management, things are really being actioned ‚Äî the gym is cleaner, friendlier, and you can see real improvements happening. It‚Äôs a great space with quality cardio and strength equipment, and a good mix of patrons. You never have to wait long for machines, which makes a big difference.

There‚Äôs also a sauna and excellent free weights. The only areas that could still use some attention are the change rooms ‚Äî they need to be a bit cleaner ‚Äî and getting back to 24/7 access. They said it would return, but it‚Äôs been that way since February. Once those are sorted, it‚Äôll be a solid 5-star gym.

showerReviews.reviewText:
They've never fixed the broken machines. In the ladies' gym, three treadmills have been broken for a long time; only one works.

I think they never check stock availability; there is often no toilet paper, paper towels, soap and no disinfectant.
I was in the toilet, as I was bursting, and I found no toilet paper.
I asked the clerk, and he told me to use my own towel to clean the equipment. People use their towels to wipe their sweat.
Temperature is too high even during the winter season.

I already spoke to the team about this, but nothing has changed.
The management team is really bad, and I feel sorry for the front desk team and cleaners. I heard they escalate issues to the manager every day, but nothing has changed. Some cleaners have even quit due to a lack of supplies.

I work at the city, so I have no choice; otherwise, I wouldn't use it.
showerReviews.author: Liz Seo

Let‚Äôs start with the equipment. Unreal. Huge variety of machines and all well maintained. They have a massive functional fitness room which is clean and has literally everything you can imagine. Honestly can‚Äôt think of anything else that would make it any better.

showerReviews.reviewText: Grange Beach is my absolute favourite little escape in Adelaide! It has such a calm, family-friendly vibe, unlike some of the busier city beaches. The sand is soft, the water is incredibly clear and usually so calm ‚Äì it's perfect for a peaceful swim or just floating around on a hot day. I love walking along the jetty and watching the fishermen; it's so picturesque. The grassy areas behind the beach are ideal for a picnic or just laying out a towel and reading a book. There are also a couple of lovely cafes right across the road for a coffee or an ice cream. It‚Äôs the perfect spot to unwind, forget the time, and just enjoy the simple, beautiful moments by the water.

showerReviews.reviewText: We were looking for a place to stay overnight, handy to North Adelaide restaurants, this place looked ideal. We signed up to the membership to get a discount but this wasn't applied at payment(don't know why) so we paid full price, which definitely wasn't value for money. There was a used towel hanging on the back of the bathroom door(yuck!). The window sills were covered in dust and dead bugs. There were spiders and webs in the bedroom corners. There was a nasty stain on the sofa and the laminate had been peeled from the edge of the "dining" table. We opened the cupboard in the kitchen that had the bin it and the smell was horrendous(close that up quickly and don't reopen). However, the shower was nice and hot and the bed was very comfortable. Unfortunately, we can't recommend this place and won't stay there again.

locations.title: Discovery Parks - Adelaide Beachfront
locations.address: ÓÉà349 Military Rd, Semaphore Park SA 5019

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed at this park for 8 days over new years 25/26 with a large group of 5 vans on sites. Beautiful location . On the third night thieves ran through the park and stole bikes, food from the camp kitchen, shoes from sites and a generator. The park sends out lock up your valuables texts, however plays down the fact that the thieves walk through the park during the day and take stuff while you are at your sites- for example two electric bikes were attempted to be stolen in broad daylight and toiletries from the shower.

There is no security in the park at all with these problems, not even at night and the staff are uninterested in helping or showing empathy toward  the situation and just tell you to go the police.The gates to the beach rarely work and I am not sure how often they change the code.

If you search the park on the internet it describes the significant problem of high crime rate and items being stolen regularly. If you are going to run a park with full knowledge of this, invest in better security and consequences. Why wouldn't the thieves come to this park? There is nothing to stop them.

Any holidayer would be happy to pay extra to ensure security and it is disappointing for such a careless approach to be considered sufficient from a discovery park.
showerReviews.author: clare DHC

locations.title: Levi Adelaide Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉà1A Harris Rd, Vale Park SA 5081

showerReviews.reviewText:
I‚Äôve recently had the chance to stay at Levi Holiday Park, and I wanted to share my experience. First off, the park is set in such a beautiful location, surrounded by lush greenery and close to nature, which really adds to the overall atmosphere.

We have been coming here for work on several occasions and each time we found the different cabins we stayed in were comfortable and clean. I appreciated the variety of options available, from cabins to camping spots, catering to different preferences and budgets. Our favourite are the King William cabins. All cabins are well-equipped with everything we needed for our stay.

One of the highlights for me was the friendly staff. You can tell the managers set a great example for the staff to follow, all of them were welcoming and always ready to help with any questions we had. They were so easy going which made

booking and checking in so easy! You could tell they genuinely wanted to make our stay enjoyable.

The amenities were super clean and they have a small shop on site for basic supplies. We also enjoyed some lovely walks around the park after work and the peaceful atmosphere made it easy to relax.

Overall, I had a great time at Levi Holiday Park. It‚Äôs a perfect spot for tradesman working in the area, families or anyone looking to unwind in nature. I‚Äôd definitely recommend to stay here if you are visiting the area.
showerReviews.author: Tyson Barrington

showerReviews.reviewText:
We stayed three nights. I don't know why this park is so hyped, to be honest.
The ensuite sites are tiny and old. Our little one burnt himself when washing his hands. No-go. Water temperature needs to be regulated. The shared bathrooms are no better. All dated and not very inviting. There is just one camp kitchen in the park and the park is huge. The other area labeled camp kitchen can hardly be called one. There is nowhere to sit or cook, unless you are ok with just a microwave, a kettle and toaster. The playgrounds are nice but there is great ones in the city, too. There is going to be a toddler pool soon,  it's under construction. We wanted to check in at 1pm but were told our ensuite is not ready. We could still do the check in and park on our site but had to go back to get the key at 2pm. The key has already been there when we checked in. There was noone cleaning between 1pm and 2pm, so I don't really get what that was all about. Same thing happened to our neighbors.
showerReviews.author: sandra l.

locations.title: Aspen Holidays Adelaide Caravan Park | Inner City East
locations.address: ÓÉà46 Richmond St, Hackney SA 5069

showerReviews.reviewText:
I chose Aspen Holidays Adelaide Caravan Park because they advertise as pet-friendly (with a hefty pet fee, I might add), and I was traveling with my two cats. What a huge mistake.
The cabin itself was outdated, and the beds were incredibly uncomfortable ‚Äì my cats refused to settle on them at all and spent most of the time on the floor or furniture instead. But the real nightmare was the state of cleanliness, or lack thereof.
The provided kitty litter was the cheapest black-and-gold stuff imaginable, and it looked like it hadn‚Äôt been changed or topped up in weeks ‚Äì absolutely disgusting and unusable. My cats were horrified and basically held it in until we could get proper supplies.
Worst of all, the cabin and surrounding park grounds were overrun with mice. My cats spent the entire stay in full hunting mode, chasing rodents around the cabin at all hours, under the beds, in the kitchen area, and even outside in the park. It was chaotic, stressful, and frankly revolting. This level of rodent presence points to serious sanitation issues ‚Äì if mice are running rampant, what else is lurking?
For a place that charges extra for pets and claims to be welcoming to them, they clearly haven‚Äôt put any thought into maintaining a clean, pest-free environment. The location near the CBD is convenient, but that‚Äôs about the only positive. I won‚Äôt be returning, and I strongly advise anyone traveling with pets (or anyone who values hygiene) to look elsewhere. Absolute letdown.
showerReviews.author: Jacob Mitilineos

showerReviews.reviewText:
While the cabin was quite compact, and perhaps a bit expensive for its size, there were a few other issues during our 3-night stay.

We didn't receive any follow-up from staff to check on our experience or to offer fresh towels. The bathroom was notably small making it difficult to use, and we found the door lock was non-functional due to a missing strike plate.

The bunk beds were not the greatest, with thin mattresses on what appeared to be homemade wooden frames. We experienced a-lot of discomfort, even after combining mattresses. Some of the linen was dirty and couldn‚Äôt be used.

The music festival during our stay created significant noise from teen concertgoers. The park seemed to be at full capacity, with tents pitched in unusual spots, like between cabins and in parking spaces, and some cabins appeared to be over-occupied.

The laundry facilities were also problematic, with many machines out of service. One machine left a brown residue on our clothes, requiring a second wash. We had to resort to using a laundromat 3 minutes away, due to the limited availability and a significant delay caused by unattended laundry by other guests.

Overall, while we appreciate the park's location, we feel that some improvements in maintenance and guest services are required urgently.

I would not recommend or stay again.
showerReviews.author: Brad Davies

locations.title: Marion Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉà323 Sturt Rd, Bedford Park SA 5042

showerReviews.reviewText:
The Marion Holiday Park is an excellent choice whilst visiting Adelaide. Marion Park is situated close to the beach, cbd, cinema, shopping & easy public transport access. It is also close to all commercial needs by 30-40 minutes. Park facilities extend to evening childrens movies with availability to purchase meals & open bar, great swimming pool & water park, cafe including sale of selected items for your room or caravan and amazing Team to assist with any request or local knowledge. There is also an amazing natural park with open grassed playing areas, trees 500+ years old & space for kids to run freely neighbouring these grounds. I look forward to staying here again on my next visit to Adelaide.
Wonderful stay, thanks Marion Park Team.
showerReviews.author: Jodie Catling

showerReviews.reviewText:
‚õ∫Ô∏èPerfect for a few nights.

This caravan park has all the amenities you need. The kitchen is really well equipped and even as a TV and book for entertainment. The park itself is not that big but clean and simple.

For anybody with tents looking to stay here during winter, look for a sight that‚Äôs not directly on the beach. The wind is very strong and was very consistent. I saw most of the tents sadly collapsed.

I paid 30$ per night for an unpowered site, which is great for the location and what you get.

There are two downsides:
1. There are a few long stay guests that have alcohol problems and I didn‚Äôt feel tooo safe around them. BUT nothing happened, it‚Äôs just me being cautious.
2. The wifi is useless. If your looking to have good wifi for videos or social media, then this is not the park you want to stay at.

Otherwise the staff was friendly and efficient.

Overall very fair price and good spot.
showerReviews.author: jOHANN

2. The wifi is useless. If your looking to have good wifi for videos or social media, then this is not the park you want to stay at.

Otherwise the staff was friendly and efficient.

Overall very fair price and good spot.
showerReviews.author: jOHANN

showerReviews.reviewText:

Other than a good camp kitchen this park is VERY basic, very small play area for kids (for safety needs to be fenced along S25).

Sites are extremely small and PACKED! Caravans at odd angles to get as many as possible on the grassed area near gates.

VERY expensive for a basic park at $70 per night.

locations.title: NRMA Victor Harbor Beachfront Holiday Park
locations.address: ÓÉà114 Victoria St, Victor Harbor SA 5211

showerReviews.reviewText: We tented on a powered site. The space for each site is very narrow and is quickly consumed by a tent, parked car and trailer. The amenities are kept clean and well maintained. The camp kitchens are limited and could be improved with more modern amenities. The water park, pump track and pool is great for young kids. The definite highlight of staying here though has been the proximity to Victor Harbour and the beach. It's an easy walk or bike ride into the town centre and the beach is a short walk over the dunes. Would be happy to return for holidays in the future.
showerReviews.author: Benjamin Kuchel

Everything in room made us feel very cozy and complemetary drinks, chocolates, chips & drinks added better welcome feeling. showerReviews.reviewText:
We recently stayed here for a four day holiday and whilst the staff were lovely, the cabin was definitely not value for money. It‚Äôs extremely disappointing how there are so many reviews about the cleanliness being poor and the owners ‚Äúbeing told‚Äù and yet nothing is changing. We booked into a two bedroom cabin and I am so glad we had our own bedding and cutlery because I would not have wanted to use any of what was provided.

Cleanliness of the cabin was extremely poor. There was mould on the roof of the shower, the walls and doors were peeling, dust and cobwebs on the curtains, food residue within the couch, the floor was sticky and filthy, cutlery was not clean at all and the smart tv couldn‚Äôt even access the internet onsite so the only available tv was standard channels. We had the groundsman come and look at the tv only for him to be told by reception that it doesn‚Äôt work with the internet. If you want to sit and relax and watch subscription tv, forget it. Unless you bring your own wifi, the internet onsite doesn‚Äôt allow for much and phone reception is extremely poor.

On the plus side there is a lovely cafe onsite that serves great coffee and banana bread and the staff are fantastic.

This is my second time staying and my families first and unfortunately will probably be our last  based on our recent stay. It is a real shame because the location is incredible.
showerReviews.author: Sorrelle Mittra

Terrible experience. The two ladies working in the reception building are completly rude, unfriendly and unhelpful. Paid for a 5 night stay with 6 guests. We asked for extra clean towels and coffee on our third night and were refused. We were met with the reply ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt do that here‚Äù and given nasty looks.
For our 5 night stay, they gave us 2 toilet rolls, and when we asked for extra they were hesitant and unhappy with us. Never seen two people as miserable as those ladies.
Recommended the holiday park train their staff better, because we will not be returning due to this poor service.
The only positive of the park, is the beach view. Tip for the front service ladies; A smile goes a long way, give it a go!

showerReviews.reviewText: We just had a wonderful 3 night stay at Moonta Bay Holiday Park. It was an easy drive from Adelaide. Check in was an easy process. We loved how the boom gate recognises your car number plate, so we didn‚Äôt need to enter code when entering each time. We stayed in a 3 bedroom cabin overlooking the jetty. It was probably the cleanest cabin we‚Äôve ever stayed in, spotless and extremely new and well made. The kitchen was equipped with everything we needed. Beds were comfortable and plenty of linen and towels. Bathrooms were generous sizes with a seperate toilet for main bathroom which was so helpful. The view from the balcony is stunning! It is a tight squeeze to get your car in the parking spot and able to open doors, that‚Äôs the only thing to be mindful of if you have a big car. The kids loved the jumping pillow and playground inside the park. The splash zone right next door was a huge hit. Despite not having a pool, the waterslides were a great alternative to the beach for the kids. We already can‚Äôt wait to book again for next year! Thank you for a wonderful stay!
showerReviews.author: Hannah Williams

showerReviews.reviewText:
Initially booked a Lower Powered Site ($45) with the intention of putting up a tent, upon receiving our site location, it was obvious we were not going to be able to pitch our tent, as the ground is ROCK SOLID. We went up to Reception to ask to be relocated, Reception advised that all the sites have the same soil and we'll not be able to pitch a tent. So we were offered to upgrade to a suite, at an additional cost of $105.

The room was decent, by holiday park standards, it was clean, well kept, and everything worked. The park amenities and facilities are nice, the BBQ area is well maintained, lawns are looked after, lots of activities if you have kids.

We stayed to head to the jetty and go crabbing/fishing/squiding, had no luck this time, but previous trips we have seen an abundance of squid and crabs.

Location is great, service was good, just disappointed about the tent situation - but the room was good quality. WiFi was hitting around 0.5mbps, Voda reception was pinging around 50-60mbps.
showerReviews.author: Kym Ozols

showerReviews.reviewText:
For those after a budget friendly family holiday, I would highly recommend the Big 4 Holiday Park in Mannum.   Conveniently located on Purnong Road, and nestled along the banks of the River Murray, the park is in close walking proximity to local pubs,  the Mannum Club, Supermarket and local attractions.

The facilities are plenty with a basketball and tennis court, a kids playground, a large camp kitchen with dishwasher, wood fired pizza oven, free BBQs, boat ramp, kiosk, laundry and amenities block.

The accommodation options are varied from a large range of cabins, powered (water front and water views) and unpowered sites.

We stayed in a superior cabin for 3 nights.   The cabin was modern, spotlessly clean and the beds and linen were clean and comfortable.   Our cabin had wheelchair ramp access, a concerted parking bay and a great patio with river views.  The bathroom was spotless and again had easy access for wheelchairs.   The cabin was spacious, well appointed and had a full size fridge with lots of storage.   There was an outdoor deck with seating and a private BBQ supplied.

Check in was easy, and the staff were very friendly and accommodating.  The park itself was well organised, secure and quiet.  You can even bring your dog along for the journey
showerReviews.author: I Ate My Crusts

locations.title: The Retreat at West Beach Parks (Formerly West Beach Parks Resort)
locations.address: ÓÉàMilitary Rd, West Beach SA 5024

showerReviews.reviewText:
Stayed 3 nights in sea dragon cabins. Great location, very friendly and helpful staff, good size space but everything very old and broken.
Had to call maintenance 3 times during our stay. Tv didn‚Äôt work until our last day despite 2 x maintenance calls. Fridge broke and our food went off (did get reimbursed). Bathroom plug was stuck down so couldn‚Äôt use bathroom sink. Blinds didn‚Äôt go all way down. Giant cockroach in my bed!
We wanted to stay and use the park facilities but were very disappointed. Games room was 4 old arcade games that only one worked. Gym was a bench and 2 spin bikes and not inviting at all. Good basketball court and jumpy pillow. Washing machine in room but no where on site to get washing powder.
I have 3 x kids under 8 and the pool wasn‚Äôt suitable for their swimming abilities. I‚Äôm 5‚Äô2 and the pool was up the my shoulders at the shallow end. The kids section is too small to use and drops off above my head.
Very disappointed as a mum with her 3 kids who travelled 6 hours to stay here. Will not be staying again and will not recommend.
showerReviews.author: Hilary Sampson

showerReviews.reviewText: Literally everything was broken. Games room screens/keyboards did not work, gokarts unavailable, laundry room not in operation, mugs were stained brown inside, toilet roll holder & towel rails both falling off the wall, not to mention our key even broke in the lock of the screen door & we had to leave our room unlocked when we went out for dinner. ‚ÄòGym‚Äô has two exercise bikes & a couple of dumbbells. The dumbbell rack isn‚Äôt even full, holds a couple of light hand weights only. Playground extremely dated. Will not re book, my children were bored bored bored.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Don't have much positive to say sadly. Four of us stayed in the Sand Dunes cabin and the photos online made the living area look much less cramped than it actually was. The lack of supplied extras that every other self contained unit i've stayed in was also very annoying. No oil for the BBQ, no alfoil, not even salt and pepper. These are very cheap items that would've saved a few trips to the local Drakes. There was also only one of the smallest pieces of soap for four people for three days. Yes we could have gone to reception to get more but why not just have a few spare in the drawers for customer convenience? Bedrooms were nice and beds were comfortable. Bathroom was also very nice and the shower lovely.

Lastly we were super disappointed at the pool. My 9 year old who is not a strong swimmer had either the option of the tiny 20cm in height baby section or drown in the shallowest area which was 1.2M. I appreciate you can't change the depth of the pool but if i'd seen on your website the shallowest area is 1.2M we wouldnt have booked it. Oh, and if that pool was actually 28 degrees I would be very surprised.

The gym and the games room was laughable. We won't be back and i'm very disappointed with how much money we paid.
showerReviews.author: Stephanie

showerReviews.reviewText:
This family orientated campground is an awesome gem. You can hear and see koalas in front of your campsite, can't get any better!

Very helpful and lovely management team, Rachel and Mike are the best. We planned to stay for 2 nights but stayed almost 5 weeks over the silly Xmas season as we had several car issues. Rachel always ensured we can stay, which was great peace of mind and so appreciated.

Great facilities with camp kitchen and huge dining table where different travellers meet and connect. Fiona ensured the kitchen and bathrooms were clean and spotless every day, but some travellers manage to get it dirty in no time.

Great locations for day excursions and city trips. The atmosphere over Xmas and New year was very unique, so family friendly with the kids playing on the open field.

I would give 10 stars if I could, very affordable and beautiful campground!
showerReviews.author: Sophia Friese

locations.title: Adelaide Travellers Inn Backpackers Hostel
locations.address: ÓÉà220 Hutt St, Adelaide SA 5000

showerReviews.reviewText:
This hostel isn‚Äôt for everyone ‚Äî it might be okay for a single night if you‚Äôve just landed in Adelaide, but for anything longer, it‚Äôs not ideal.

The people staying here were friendly and the staff were great ‚Äî really welcoming and helpful. However, the hostel itself needs serious improvement. When I checked in, I asked about lockers and was told the rooms don‚Äôt even have locks. That means anyone could technically walk in off the street and access your room. Because of this, I ended up carrying my laptop and passport with me whenever I went out, and left only my clothes behind on the bed.

When I returned after being out for about eight hours, I was relieved to find nothing had been touched ‚Äî but the door to my room was wide open and there was a strong smell of weed inside. On closer inspection, the door was actually off its hinges!

The air conditioning didn‚Äôt work at all, and with temperatures around 30¬∞C, it was incredibly uncomfortable at night. The mattress was thin and uncomfortable, and the top bunk had no safety rail, which felt unsafe. The floorboards were so creaky that every step in the hallway woke me up.

The bathrooms were clean but basic. The showers were hot and powerful, but one of the bathroom lights didn‚Äôt work, meaning you had to use your phone torch at night.

The WiFi was strong and the location was convenient ‚Äî about a 20‚Äì25 minute walk to the railway station, and buses stop right outside. However, the hidden entrance and sketchy vibe from some people walking by at night didn‚Äôt give the best first impression.

I had originally booked three nights but ended up checking out after one, moving to another hostel. On a positive note, there was a BBQ on the balcony which was a great touch ‚Äî everyone was social, friendly, and respectful. The kitchen, lounge, and common areas were good and encouraged socialising.

Overall, it‚Äôs a friendly and sociable hostel with lovely staff, but the room conditions, lack of security, and poor maintenance really let it down. With a few repairs and better safety measures, it could be a great spot for backpackers.
showerReviews.author: John White

showerReviews.reviewText:
DO NOT BOOK THIS HOSTEL. This place was so disgusting that we walked straight back out the door and did not stay there. It is FILTHY. Every room smells like body odour. The rooms are tiny and there are no working lights in the rooms. The keys to the rooms do not work and you have to barge the door in. We were not asked for passports on arrival, so anyone could be in the rooms with you. The beds didn't even have mattresses on when we arrived and the staff member said they'd go and fetch one from the back room. The other beds were not made. There was a vent in the room where there was a pigeon defecating and cooing, which was echoing around the whole room. The carpets were not hoovered.
The bathroom was covered in black mould and the floor had not been wiped. There were used razors all over the floor of the shower and mounds of hair in the plug holes. We have been trying to get a refund from the hostel for over a month now and booking.com customer service has been no help whatsoever. AVOID AT ALL COSTS, especially if you're female or travelling solo. I hope this place gets shut down.
showerReviews.author: Leah Tudor

The bathroom was covered in black mould and the floor had not been wiped. There were used razors all over the floor of the shower and mounds of hair in the plug holes. We have been trying to get a refund from the hostel for over a month now and booking.com customer service has been no help whatsoever. AVOID AT ALL COSTS, especially if you're female or travelling solo. I hope this place gets shut down.
showerReviews.author: Leah Tudor

locations.title: Mitchell Park Sports and Community Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà139 Bradley Grove, Mitchell Park SA 5043

showerReviews.reviewText:
As someone who recently visited the Mitchell Park Sports and Community Center, I was thoroughly impressed by the range of amenities and activities available. The newly constructed halls for basketball, volleyball, and netball were spacious and well-equipped, making them ideal for sports enthusiasts of all ages. Additionally, the dedicated spaces for parties, meetings, and children's activities provided a welcoming environment for community gatherings.

I particularly enjoyed participating in the exercise classes held in the evenings, which offered a great way to stay active and meet new people. The weekend dog training sessions were also a highlight, providing valuable opportunities for pet owners to bond with their furry friends while learning new skills.

Outside, the well-maintained fields for football, cricket, and tennis provided ample space for recreational sports, and I appreciated the addition of the remote control car racing ramp, which added a unique and exciting element to the park.

Overall, my experience at the Mitchell Park Sports and Community Center was extremely positive, and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and inclusive destination for sports, recreation, and community engagement.

locations.title: MARS Sports Centre
locations.address: ÓÉàLower Portrush Rd, Marden SA 5070

showerReviews.reviewText:
After my previous scathing review I thought it only fair to delete it and do a new one after the previous manager of the main courts has been removed in 2023.
The owner has taken control and while trying to make things better hasn't really done in right.
The toilets are still unclean after a major refurbish and I would still rather use a tree than stand in other peoples urine as they rarely if ever get cleaned, women's toilet may be a different story as I didn't go in there.
Paper towels regularly run out and the bin is overflowing and due to vandals the soap dispenser is not available most times.
The smell is sometimes unbearable.
They have tried to "cool" the courts down with several very large portable evaporative air units but water hasn't been added so they are basically just very loud fans blowing hot air around.
New scoreboards are being installed(March 2024) but should be on the wall and not at ground level which makes it hard to even see the score and time remaining when players are in the way.
Cafeteria is rarely open.
I guess they tried :-(
showerReviews.author: Paul Lelys

locations.title: The Lights Community and Sports Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà244 - 270 East Parkway Corner Hampstead Road and, 244-270 East Pkwy, Lightsview SA 5085
locations.street: ÓÉà244 - 270 East Parkway Corner Hampstead Road and

showerReviews.reviewText:
A modern and very well maintained sports facility in Lightsview, with 5 spacious multi-purpose sports courts. The building was completed in late 2019 but it still looks pretty new.

There are several meeting, function or community rooms inside the sports complex too. There is a cafe nearby the entrance with plenty of seating.

The lighting system is well designed and all the 5 courts are perfectly illuminated and with sufficient headroom for carrying exerercies like badminton and volleyball etc. In this regard, I rank these 5 courts to be the best community sports counts in Adelaide.

However, this sports centre doesn't provide gym room like ARC Compbelltown, the Parks YMCA (24/7 gym) and St Clair YMCA (24/7 gym). There is no swimming pool in this sports centre, so in this regard the Parks YMCA and ARC Compbelltown excel as they both have swimming pools.

There are a lot of outdoor parking spots so this is definitely a great place for doing indoor sports.
showerReviews.author: Pat Chung

Absolutely amazing. Yes yes yes!  I was gifted the ‚Äòtravellers package‚Äô for a birthday present. Offered tea and water on entry, then taken to my own candle lit private room which was welcoming, smelt beautifully and exceptionally clean. Rooms also have private toilet/shower facilities attached.
Mel gave me an amazing massage and worked out all of my achey niggles. - Thank you so much!
To follow, Rita provided a wonderful facial and scalp massage. I even got to choose what oils she used on my scalp. I look & feel so rejuvenated. I couldn‚Äôt stop smiling.
I will be recommending Swiss wellness to everyone I meet. All staff are absolutely lovely and so so accomodating.
If this is for yourself or a gift for a friend, you will not be disappointed.

Huge Thank you again to Mel and Rita for starting my morning off and helping me fill my cup.

showerReviews.reviewText: What a beautiful experience me and my girlfriends had at Temple Day Spa. You feel relaxed as soon as you walk through the door. The music is so lovely too. I am a beauty therapist myself and have had many massages in my time, my therapist was unreal. Great pressure, good communication. Probably the best massage I've had in my life. Vichy shower was different to another I've had in the past. This one was in an egg shell type pod which made me feel a little claustrophobic. I laughed and said you better not be leaving me in here alone!?. My therapist reassured me saying no of course not and she was there giving me a scalp massage throughout the treatment. I could communicate with her when it became a bit too steamy and hot which was great. About half way through I didn't love the repetitive sprays of the vischy shower anymore, it became annoying for me and found it hard to relax. I'd love to chat with the owner about a few touches I loved and a recommendation to improve on. Overall an amazing experience and I will so be back if I ever visit Adelaide again!
showerReviews.author: Caitlin Mewton

locations.title: Selene Spa and Wellness
locations.address: ÓÉà97 Currie St, Adelaide SA 5000

showerReviews.reviewText:
Selene is Adelaide CBD‚Äôs new luxury spa offering. It did not disappoint.

The moment you step in, you can tell that attention to detail has been paid to this luxe venue for pampering and holistic healing.

The spa is well-designed and appointed. Located in the old Dunn & Bradstreet building, ceilings are high. Like top notch spa retreats overseas, there is the sense of space and air that immediately lowers your cortisol levels.

Cassidy, the spa manager is warm and unlike a lot of other spas, you can feel her genuine warmth and kindness. She connects to clients in an empathetic way which is not fake like in many high-end spas.

I tried their seasonal offering: ‚ÄúSpring Ayurvedic Detox Ritual‚Äù together with an Indian Head Massage. (Details available on their web site).

I think every spa treatment should start with an Indian head massage. It is an ideal way to start your relaxation journey.

Dr Shweta, their resident Ayurvedic practitioner is professional and knowledgable. If you have not tried Ayurvedic treatments before, you should. They are treatments that are filled with warmth and positive healing vibes. Dr Shweta‚Äôs energy is calm and nurturing and that energy flows through all her treatments.

The spa is as of writing (September 2025) still very new.

Parking is either available in the car park off Gilles Arcade or opposite at the rear of the Sofitel Hotel.

I did provide feedback about the size of the change room and how top-end resort spas have their change facilities depending on the client‚Äôs treatments.

I listened to Dr Shweta‚Äôs instructions post-treatment and am feeling detoxed and definitely more relaxed the day after. The herbal powder scrub massage has made my skin even smoother. It would have been nice to shower after the head massage and herbal powder scrub because it was not 100% comfortable lying there with the scrub grains. I am used to having a shower after scrubs.

After my treatment, I got to relax in the lounge with some warm water, warm tea and light snacks. The protein balls are made by the owner and are delicious. The date stuffed with walnuts was perfect. I wish I had asked for an extra protein ball but I was in such bliss that I didn‚Äôt think about it.

I definitely will be back to try a regular massage and facial.

I am sure it will not be long before Selene takes top spot as Adelaide‚Äôs best spa. If you have been to the spa at Eon Skycity, this rivals them in terms of the level of luxe. The only thing that is missing is the steam room, sauna, jacuzzi and pool. However, Selene do have a cocoon pod and herbal steam bath.

Looking forwards to my next visit!
showerReviews.author: Mi Ro

locations.title: Cocoon Spa
locations.address: ÓÉà409 Magill Rd, St Morris SA 5068

showerReviews.reviewText:
If you don't gel with abrupt people, this isn't the place for you. You're paying for a service, but they act like you're bothering them, just walking through the door. Every time I've had a service, they've either been short-staffed, or made a booking error, or running behind etc (this has happened on at least 5 occasions). I don't mind waiting, I'm chilled out, I understand things can go wrong. But to then be met with rudeness like they've had to go above and beyond to accommodate me, when I am in fact the one accommodating them (even though I'm punctual) and paying them, it's frustrating. They're my local, but even this chilled gal's at her end with this. I'm paying to de-stress, not to be amped up walking in and walking out.

The services are good, I've only had one rough service, a facial, she kept rubbing my face down with a dry towel, and the edging was too abrasive for my soft/thin face skin. This was a one-off on one of the days when they made a booking error.
showerReviews.author: Alana Winter

showerReviews.reviewText: I recently got in touch with Cove Spa to book for my family from the UK while on holidays here in Perth. I arranged to have some treatments for my 2 sisters and mother. Everything about the experience was brilliant. The reception staff were so friendly and accommodating, they went above and beyond to find a suitable booking for me. My family were greeted by the happiest staff they said they have ever come across and were shown into a lovely relaxation area to enjoy drinks and nibbles before and after their treatments. The spa rooms were decadent with showers and baths and the massage beds were warm and comfortable. Their massages and facials were the best my family have ever had and each of their therapists were so professional and extremely knowledgeable. They said "all the therapists have magic healing hands" and they felt as if they had left as completely new women! They actually organised to visit Cove again once more before flying home to the UK. The whole process was 5 star quality and i would highly recommend anyone to visit Cove Spa, I certainly will be sending friends and family to Cove again.
showerReviews.author: Adam Parsons

showerReviews.reviewText: I have been coming here way before EOS spa got replaced with BOHDI spa and I‚Äôve got to say it was a massive downgrade. I paid around $280 for specifically a deep tension release massage and it was the softest massage ever, Claire had absolutely no idea on how to get deep knots out of the body nor massage properly which is annoying by because these massages are not cheap. My money was wasted and I would have got a better recovery if I went down to the Chinese spot down the road for $50. If you don‚Äôt want a wasted disappointing massage then please avoid Claire. Next time I go will be mainly for spa amenities and I will make sure I avoid Claire at all costs. My grandmother with 0 massage experience could have massaged me better.

locations.title: Largs Bay Swim Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà195 Victoria Rd, Largs Bay SA 5016

showerReviews.reviewText:
My daughter katalina swims here started her swimming lessons late at the age of 4 this instructors are absolutely fantastic and the the desk staff are very kind and understand when you have unforeseen circumstances that affect your account.

I‚Äôve been thoroughly impressed from day one.The instructors are patient, engaging, and clearly passionate about teaching water confidence. They have an incredible way of making lessons both fun and structured, which is perfect for young learners. My daughter, who was initially a little hesitant, now looks forward to every session with excitement.

The facility itself is well-maintained, with warm water that keeps the little ones comfortable while they learn. The class sizes are just right‚Äînot too crowded‚Äîso every child gets plenty of attention. I also appreciate how the staff creates a positive and encouraging environment, celebrating each small milestone, which really boosts the kids‚Äô confidence.

Another highlight is the centre‚Äôs family-friendly atmosphere. It‚Äôs easy for parents to watch their children‚Äôs progress, and the staff are always approachable if you have any questions. Booking lessons was a breeze, and the overall experience has been nothing but smooth.

Largs Bay Swim Centre has given my daughter a fantastic start to her swimming journey. If you‚Äôre considering lessons for your child, I‚Äôd highly recommend this place‚Äîit‚Äôs a gem for little swimmers
showerReviews.author: Beer Man

showerReviews.reviewText:
First of all I‚Äôd like to say Jane is a fantastic instructor, and has been nothing short of amazing, in guiding our little girl with her swimming journey. Sadly that‚Äôs where the good points end. The Wednesday swimming lessons were cancelled, due to the education department now using these days for school lessons, which we understood.
We cancelled our membership, as we couldn‚Äôt do the alternative weekdays, and weekends were booked out. We wanted to finish up and use the last two lessons we had paid for. Karen, who works the desk, spoke to my wife in a putrid manner, and told us that we HAD to have our lessons in the following 2 weeks (one weekend was booked out and the next was Easter).
After speaking with the manager, we were able to come to a solution to use them at a later date.
The next time my wife went in, and tried to book the two lessons, Karen said we were still not entitled to them.
It has all become too hard and we don‚Äôt feel welcome here.
We won‚Äôt be recommending this venue to friends or family.
showerReviews.author: Trent Watts

locations.title: Glenelg North Beach

showerReviews.reviewText: Lovely for viewing sunsets. Ok for swimming but not near rocks and watch out for dangerous currents. Last 2 nights there has been an icecream van along the parking strip! :)

showerReviews.author: Gen Maloney

showerReviews.reviewText: Glenelg North Beach is a stunning stretch of coastline located just a short walk from the bustling town center of Glenelg. From the moment you arrive, you'll be struck by the pristine white sand and crystal-clear water, which make for a truly picturesque setting. The beach itself is well-maintained and spacious, with plenty of room for sunbathing, swimming, and playing beach games. There are also several volleyball nets set up for those who want to get active. The water is relatively calm, making it ideal for swimming or wading in the shallows. One of the highlights of Glenelg North Beach is the Sunset Bar, which offers stunning views of the ocean and the surrounding coastline. The drinks and food are both excellent, and the atmosphere is relaxed and welcoming. It's the perfect place to unwind after a long day at the beach. Another great feature of Glenelg North Beach is the nearby jetty, which is a popular spot for fishing and sightseeing. You can take a leisurely stroll along the jetty and take in the views, or cast a line and try your luck at catching some fish. The only downside of Glenelg North Beach is that it can get quite busy, especially on weekends and holidays. However, even when it's crowded, the beach is still a beautiful and enjoyable place to spend time. Overall, I highly recommend Glenelg North Beach for anyone looking for a stunning and accessible beach experience. The views, amenities, and atmosphere are all top-notch, and it's a great place to relax and unwind.
showerReviews.author: Johnny To the Mars

locations.address: ÓÉà16 Holdfast Promenade, Glenelg SA 5045

showerReviews.reviewText:
UGH. Avoid.

The best thing you can sawy about this place is the location - perfectly right on the beach; but the rest was bad: overpriced, ugly, spare rooms - stark white walls; cups in the gym gone; water jug empty; bathtub paint peeling so you couldn't take a bath; lamp in the room busted, carpets stained, no phone in the room. advertised room with a kitchen - got no actual cooking knife; so couldn't actually cook; asked for one and they eventually brought me a steak knife; useless. as i used the forks the turn down crew would come and just take them - not wash them, but literally just take them so that i started the week with three forks and ended with none in the room. turn down crew left messes uncleaned, bed unmade; the hotel nickel and dimed for parking; charged extra for cheap coffee pods; and WORST of all; TERRIBLE INTERNET! I travel all over and this was the worst internet experience I've seen in years; you have to sign in every time; it kicks you off intermittently; and it's super slow. no paid upgrade - like bad airport internet; in a "four star" hotel? no way. -restaurant disconnected from the hotel so no room service though it's offered. Service bad too - multiple times called down to front desk and got no answer; multiple times told them about all this stuff and got no answer or action.  people at the front desk didn't know what they were doing. Felt like a cheap motel; not a hotel.
Nice to be right on the beach tho. and, surprisingly, the sauna slapped :)
showerReviews.author: Mischa Byruck

My only gripe would be that the stove was very slow to heat up‚Ä¶ but in the scheme of things this park was clean, quiet, and while it lacked a bit in charm, it was super conveniently located.  Perhaps not for families, but ideal for single travellers passing through.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I don‚Äôt normally leave negative reviews, but I‚Äôm really disappointed with my recent experience at Endota Spa Glenelg.

My friend and I booked a double massage as a treat for ourselves for our birthdays.
We had a 12:30pm booking for a one-hour massage on Saturday 12th July. We arrived at 12pm, as advised, to complete paperwork and be ready to begin on time. Despite this, the massage didn‚Äôt start until well after the scheduled time, and we only received 45 minutes of treatment instead of the full hour.

I emailed the spa three days ago to share my feedback privately, but haven‚Äôt received a response‚Äîwhich just adds to the frustration.

To make matters worse, one of the masseuses was clearly unwell during the treatment coughing the whole time and ended up passing on her illness to her client, my friend, which is completely unacceptable in any professional setting, let alone a spa where hygiene and wellness are meant to be a priority.

This was supposed to be a relaxing and rejuvenating experience, but I left feeling disappointed, short-changed, and ignored.
showerReviews.author: Kendra Webb

showerReviews.reviewText:
Me and my wife visited Adelaide for a short holiday trip and we were looking for a place to stop by to spend some relaxing time away from the kids and we found Revive Head Spa and Beauty on Jitty Rd.
It was a second to none experience. We both got a 90 minutes deluxe package for our hair wash and also facial massage. We got everything from hair wash, head massage, facial massage, face mask, hot stone massage, half body massage.. to many to remember.
The staff was lovely and very well trained in what they do. The atmosphere was very relaxing and calm, price was very reasonable to what the services were offered. They also offer nails/ pedicure and lashes as well if you need it done

We highly recommend if you are visiting the city or a local to visit this place and you will not be disappointed. We will definitely be back here when we visit the city again. ( Blokes can also get their services here as well, amazing experience)

locations.title: Jai Thai Massage
locations.address: ÓÉàShop 7/59 Jetty Rd, Glenelg SA 5045

showerReviews.reviewText: I had an hour massage with Nuch today which superseded my expectations. Arriving, you pay by cash or transfer, and no health cover unfortunately but it didn‚Äôt matter as it was worth it. Reasonably priced anyway. Nuch got straight to work on me and I came in with genuine sores and aches from working at a desk all the time. Neck, shoulders, arms and lower back all stuck or stiff. Nuch found all my sore spots without prompt and really worked through them all. I wish I could have stayed all day under her care. She genuinely cared about healing me and she did this 11/10! Some masseuses don‚Äôt focus on an area long enough but I felt that Nuch treated each area as a remedial massage. Also I found the hole in the table and supporting towels actually fitted my face, unlike some places. Anyway, I was out of town so it was a treat to find a good place, as they are so hard to find
showerReviews.author: sam philpot

showerReviews.reviewText:
Have been attending this gym for over a year now. Decided to cancel my membership. The gym to me doesn‚Äôt seem welcoming. Can‚Äôt even use the pool without being glared at by the men who use it. Can‚Äôt even go to try and use a locker without the woman in the bathrooms fully naked standing in the way of the lockers. Not a good look. They don‚Äôt even move out of the way for you. I‚Äôve had a couple of bad experiences with some of the gym uses where nobody would be using a certain machine and I mean nobody using it, so I go to use the machine just to have someone go completely off at me saying they were using it when this person was on something else at that time. Swearing at me making my experience feel horrible.

The cleanliness of this gym especially changerooms is filthy. A lot of the times I use the gym when cleaners are there cleaning just to have a male cleaner in the woman‚Äôs change rooms, now how about a warning or even a sign like some other places warn you if a male is cleaning woman‚Äôs change rooms at the time. Cleaners do a slack job. So much grime and floor filthy still once they‚Äôve even cleaned.

I find some of the staff are quite unwelcoming. Especially some of the personal trainers. I‚Äôve been to other gyms in the past and have always seen trainers or staff attending people who are using the gym and offer help if needed especially if you‚Äôre unsure of equipment.
I‚Äôve now decided to join a new gym, and have gone to this new gym and found everyone welcoming and staff way more helpful. First day at this new gym and already I‚Äôve learnt how to use the equipment properly.
The people and general atmosphere is my welcoming. Even the gym users are super friendly.

showerReviews.reviewText: I have found Royal Park Goodlife very accommodative and highly attentive to my fitness goals and helping me achieve profoundly over and above my expectations. One of my goals was to participate in the much needed fundraiser, The MS Mighty Swim as a team participant across a 24hr endurance swimming event. Not having grown up in a swim club and taking up swimming later in my life I was able to swim 10 KM. Two trainers I would like to champion are Lachlan, my initial personal trainer, and Emma, my Body Pump group fitness instructor. Being a female in my late 50's I felt safe in both instructors hands who understood injuries yet still actively encouraged me to push my endurance further. Emma is such a role model in Pump workshops, encouraging me to push hard, though within my limits yet also to extend results. Emma guides with intelligence and restraint as to prevent injuries yet took time from her schedule to individually assist me after class to modify incorrect techniques. In the water I am still trying to catch that black line, but I am now stronger, quicker and my recovery is efficiently timely. A big shout out and huge appreciation to Emma and Lachlan.
showerReviews.author: Dodie Dutschke

showerReviews.reviewText: I have found Royal Park Goodlife very accommodative and highly attentive to my fitness goals and helping me achieve profoundly over and above my expectations. One of my goals was to participate in the much needed fundraiser, The MS Mighty Swim as a team participant across a 24hr endurance swimming event. Not having grown up in a swim club and taking up swimming later in my life I was able to swim 10 KM. Two trainers I would like to champion are Lachlan, my initial personal trainer, and Emma, my Body Pump group fitness instructor. Being a female in my late 50's I felt safe in both instructors hands who understood injuries yet still actively encouraged me to push my endurance further. Emma is such a role model in Pump workshops, encouraging me to push hard, though within my limits yet also to extend results. Emma guides with intelligence and restraint as to prevent injuries yet took time from her schedule to individually assist me after class to modify incorrect techniques. In the water I am still trying to catch that black line, but I am now stronger, quicker and my recovery is efficiently timely. A big shout out and huge appreciation to Emma and Lachlan.
showerReviews.author: Dodie Dutschke

showerReviews.reviewText: Fantastic gym, good, clean facilities and equipment. The staff and other members have all been friendly and welcoming. A huge bonus is having the pools for use also :)

locations.title: Blackbird Fitness
locations.address: ÓÉàLevel 1, 200/220 Commercial Rd, Port Adelaide SA 5015

showerReviews.reviewText: Joined this gym after being fed up with the other bigger chains (equipment always broken, obnoxious crowds, overcrowded, etc.) and it‚Äôs been a godsend. It‚Äôs been open for a couple years but still feels very new. The equipment is good, bit different than machines I‚Äôm used to but you adjust pretty quick. Decent variety of equipment too, couple machines missing that I‚Äôd like to see but beggars can‚Äôt be choosers. The crowd here is great though, very friendly and welcoming. The owners are friendly and you‚Äôre always greeted with a smile. There is a decent variety of classes on offer which will be sure to get you working and sweating. I‚Äôve never been a big class workout person but enjoyed taking them for something different over the past 4 weeks. With the addition of clean, modern amenities, multiple infrared saunas and a steam sauna, you can‚Äôt go wrong. Selfishly, I don‚Äôt want more people to join at the risk it becomes overcrowded, but you can‚Äôt help but want these guys to succeed and see the gym pumping with people. Matter of when, not if in my opinion. Very glad I joined and intend on being a member there for a long time! Thanks Blackbird!
showerReviews.author: Phillip Janicki

locations.title: Redstar Training Centre
locations.address: ÓÉà1160 Old Port Rd, Royal Park SA 5014

showerReviews.reviewText:
Redstar is a family run Business.
Redstar is known for its Boxing so i have to admit i was a little nervous.
The Gym has 4 different sections as well as a sauna and altitude room.
I came for the Group Classes. This is your standard mix of upper, lower, cardio and recently introduced Hyrox.
The gym is 247 but also is staffed majority of the time.
They even gave a cafe!
It works well for me because I travel to the west for work so I am able to shower after training and head to work. There are 4 toilets and 2 showers as well as wheelchair friendly sections.
Honestly this gym has something for everyone but most of all I feel normal. I don't have to be insecure like I am at most other gyms. I am referring to those people that go to the gym for the fit checks and socials.
Tash is amazing and hilarious. Josh is an excellent trainer with attention to detail and Simon. Well, he's just a legend üòÄ
Come check it out.
showerReviews.author: Jen

locations.title: Lakes Resort Hotel
locations.address: ÓÉà141 Brebner Dr, West Lakes SA 5021

showerReviews.reviewText:
It's rare I stay somewhere that properly impresses me from start to finish. The Lakes Resort is one such hotel. Staff are incredible, the rooms immaculate, housekeeping top notch, and parking is actually decent, all right on the water!

PROS:
‚úÖ Some of the most professional and friendly staff I've ever encountered in Australia working the front desk!
‚úÖ Good size rooms, mine had an amazing view of the water.
‚úÖ Nicely appointed. Modern, clean, and elegant.
‚úÖ Bed was very comfortable.
‚úÖ Good assortment of pillows, firm and soft
‚úÖ Good AC
‚úÖ Blackout Curtains
‚úÖ Nice shower, with crazy good hot water all the time
‚úÖ Plentiful Parking (not reserved), BUT plenty more free options close by, although I always got a bay on site.
‚úÖ Connected to a very nice restaurant with water views.
‚úÖ Next door to big shopping centre with food options and more.

CONS:
‚ùå Not really con per say, more of a note: The corridors felt like they needed a bit of a renovation, the ceilings felt a bit old and looked a bit rough which brought the atmosphere down a little when walking to an from your room as did the elevators which felt like they needed a good service (slow doors and very clunky, felt a bit precarious)
showerReviews.author: Jet Dingo

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cannot fault any part of my experience with Lakes Resort Hotel. On a mid-week night we, along with everyone else, booked a room at the sold out Lakes Resort Hotel as we were attending another sold out gig in town. Even under the pressure of a full house every interaction with staff was so pleasant (special mention to the wonderful staff member who was on duty at breakfast and accommodated our special request and made it a breeze for us, thank you!).

The beds were comfortable and the shower was divine at the end of a long day of travelling. Lovely balcony overlooking the lake with lots of local activity to take in. The afternoon sun hits the balcony wonderfully too.

Across the road from the local Westfield and an onsite restaurant - this ticked all the boxes and more. Our booking included breakfast which to our delight was not a standard hotel buffet fare but rather a selection made-to-order from their breakfast menu with bottomless coffee/tea/juice. It didn‚Äôt feel like a breakfast as I have come to expect when it‚Äôs included in a booking but rather it felt like we were out for breakfast at a local cafe with a great view and attentive staff.
showerReviews.author: Casey Wemyss

showerReviews.reviewText:
Cannot fault any part of my experience with Lakes Resort Hotel. On a mid-week night we, along with everyone else, booked a room at the sold out Lakes Resort Hotel as we were attending another sold out gig in town. Even under the pressure of a full house every interaction with staff was so pleasant (special mention to the wonderful staff member who was on duty at breakfast and accommodated our special request and made it a breeze for us, thank you!).

showerReviews.author: Casey Wemyss

showerReviews.reviewText:
From the outside in, the hotel leans into its biggest strength: the view. The lake stretches out wide and open, and the rooms make the most of it. Big windows, a private balcony, and a slow, golden sunset that spills into the room like it belongs there.

The room itself was clean and spacious. The spa bath was generous, tucked behind a glass window that opened into the bedroom, a thoughtful design choice for couples. It gave the space a more luxurious feel, even if the finishes were starting to show their age.

The rooms are tidy but definitely ready for an update. There‚Äôs so much potential here, beautiful bones, but the styling and details feel like they‚Äôre stuck in another decade.

Just outside our room, the hallway carpet was damp and carried a strong, musty smell. It seemed like a leak or water incident had occurred, and although we didn‚Äôt let it affect the stay, it really should‚Äôve been addressed properly. A rug cleaner should have been running that day to extract the moisture from the carpet fibres. Leaving it damp creates not only an unpleasant smell, but a high risk of mould in the weeks to come.

Inside the room, it was hard to stay warm. Even with the heater on. The insulation was poor, and at night we could hear showers, toilets and baths running in neighbouring rooms. It wasn‚Äôt overly loud, but it was constant enough to disturb sleep. In moments like that, you realise how much silence matters in a hotel stay and it gave motel vibes as I had to step out to get some earplugs.

One major downside was heading down to use the pool and spa. No gowns are provided, and no pool towels are placed in the room, which meant I had to wrap myself in a bath towel and move through public areas, including a lift ride where I stood alone until a group of men stepped in. It was uncomfortable. For the safety and comfort of guests, gowns should be standard. At the very least, pool towels should be placed in room without needing to go to the desk.

The bathroom also felt dated in some ways. A single cake of soap was provided for the room, not ideal when sharing, and not particularly hygienic. A simple mounted soap pump and lotion, even a small dish of bath salts would have felt more appropriate and given the space a more luxurious feel.

Breakfast was included in the stay at knots kitchen and honestly, it was a highlight. Fresh, colourful, and with plenty of variety, everything from poached eggs to fruit bowls, yoghurt, granola, oats and juices. Each plate was beautifully presented and tasted just as good as it looked. The only thing missing was good coffee. There was pod coffee in the room, but barista made coffee wasn‚Äôt included with breakfast. It‚Äôs a small thing, but it makes a difference. Good coffee should be part of the package, not an extra charge each morning.

We had dinner at Knots Kitchen, the in house restaurant. I ordered the fish tacos and was genuinely surprised. I almost skipped them, the menu listed lettuce, which didn‚Äôt exactly inspire confidence. But what arrived was flavourful and balanced: pickled vegetables, coriander, jalape√±os, lime, cooked well and full of brightness. Easily one of the better fish tacos I‚Äôve had in Adelaide. The menu really undersells them, and from a dietary perspective alone, ingredients like that should be listed. A photo on the app or updated description would not only help people know what they‚Äôre ordering, but also do the food justice.

We also visited Tunki Ceviche & Grill during our stay, a completely separate restaurant within the hotel and it‚Äôs well worth a visit. I‚Äôve written a separate review highlighting it in more detail.

All up?
The view and food carried the stay. The rooms are clean but dated, the layout is thoughtful but in need of a refresh, and the service touches, towels, gowns, soap, could all use more intention. It‚Äôs not a bad stay, but with a little more attention to comfort, cleanliness, and detail, it could be something special.

For a girls‚Äô weekend, it worked.
For a romantic stay, I don‚Äôt feel it would hit the right notes.. not yet.
showerReviews.author: Lily

showerReviews.reviewText:
I stayed one night at Jasper Motor Inn, but unfortunately the experience was very disappointing. The next morning, I couldn‚Äôt use the shower, sink, or toilet because of a plumbing issue affecting my room. This meant I had to check out without being able to shower or even wash my face ‚Äî something that doesn‚Äôt meet basic essential needs for guests.
The receptionist, a lady at the front desk in the morning, informed me about the issue and said I would receive AUD 70 compensation through Agoda. When I asked for a receipt, she said she didn‚Äôt know how to issue one and asked me to trust her.
Later, I contacted Agoda, and they followed up with the property. Agoda confirmed that the hotel would only compensate AUD 30, not the agreed amount. They also asked me if I knew the name of the receptionist, but unfortunately I didn‚Äôt. She was the female staff member working at the front desk during my checkout that morning.
I feel the property was not being honest about the agreed compensation and failed to provide even basic essential facilities. I accepted the smaller refund to avoid further frustration, but I was very disappointed with how this was handled. I hope the management improves honesty, communication, and guest care to prevent similar experiences for future guests.
showerReviews.author: Ku Ku
