They also asked me if I knew the name of the receptionist, but unfortunately I didn‚Äôt. She was the female staff member working at the front desk during my checkout that morning.
I feel the property was not being honest about the agreed compensation and failed to provide even basic essential facilities. I accepted the smaller refund to avoid further frustration, but I was very disappointed with how this was handled. I hope the management improves honesty, communication, and guest care to prevent similar experiences for future guests.
showerReviews.author: Ku Ku

showerReviews.reviewText:
Quiet location close to city & inner suburbs.  Also close to eating places on King William Road . Bed was comfortable. New renovations are tastefully done but there are a few things lacking. Air conditioner is only cold air. There is an electric plug in heater which does work well but takes longer to heat up the room. We arrived for a late check in to a very cold room.  Would be good if they turned the heater on to heat up the room. The fridge/freezer was turned off and not cold! There was only one reading lamp for the double bed and no other good reading light for the 2nd person to read in bed. Please put towel rails for 2 towels in the bathroom so guests can choose to hang their towels to reuse  if staying longer than one night. Did not like the toilet tissue dispenser .... hard to pull toilet tissues out without tearing and not wanting to pull out. Why not have a usual toilet roll on a toilet roll holder?
Also need to provide a toaster. All other 3 star motels we've stayed in provide a toaster.
showerReviews.author: R13

showerReviews.reviewText: The campground is a great place to set up for an overnight stay. They have powered and unpowered sites, a dump spot, toilets and even a coin operated shower. One of the park volunteers came over to check us out and she was very pleasant. There is no general store in town so make sure you come with all supplies you might need. Beware also that the ADF do live firing at certain times in the adjacent sea as shown on posted notes in the park. The sounds were not that bad at all. All in all a pleasant experience.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Fantastic payed camp ground just behind the sand dune at Parham Beach. Choice of power and water or off grid if that suits. Basic shower and toilets and also a covered bbq and table area.  Most sites have a 4x3 metre mat to keep a bit of the dirt and sand out of your rig.
The very shallow water in this area means that often it‚Äôs quite a long way from the dune to the water, many hundred‚Äôs of metres in fact, so if you are hoping for a swim it would pay to check the tide times and wind forecast. It‚Äôs also possible to catch blue swimmer crabs here if you have the skills and the energy and the patience.
I particularly enjoyed the shore birds that visit, although the Adelaide International Bird Sanctuary is very close and a bit more suited to bird watching as it‚Äôs less populated.
showerReviews.author: Athfos

locations.title: Habit Day Spa
locations.address: ÓÉà2/114 Semaphore Rd, Semaphore SA 5019

showerReviews.reviewText:
Wow! What an incredible and relaxing experience! I was gifted a voucher for HABIT for my bridal shower and was saving it until right before the wedding and I‚Äôm glad I did. I was desperate for a glow up and a relaxing massage and the experience was mind-blowing. A sensory delight from beginning to end, with little touches like affirmations all around to improve my mood.

Being a plus size girl can have a lot of limitations in the wellness industry, particular at known chain businesses. But from the minute my experience began I felt truly welcome as a plus size girl. The robe was large, I didn‚Äôt hang off the bed, and everything was just perfect for me as I existed. It‚Äôs a wonderful and wholesome feeling.

Thank you, Lisa, for an incredible experience. I was feeling a bit yuck about my body this week but I‚Äôve left HABIT feeling relaxed, hydrated, and in love with my body again.
showerReviews.author: Shae Desmet

showerReviews.reviewText: What a beautiful and amazing spa! Ive always been told about having high standards.. and quite frankly Im often disappointed when I go to a new spa. This place hit the spot and ticked all my boxes! Organic, natural, low-tox products that will actually make you feel radiant and amazing instead of toxic creams to be massaged with! The place smells magical thanks to essential oils and all the rooms are just bliss. The change room makes you feel like you are in  pure lux and what to say about the massive crystals energizing the place everywhere you go. The relaxation room at the end of your treatment is the cherry on top with waterfront views, comfy lounge chairs, yummy tea and more crystals. I am so grateful to have come about this gem! Will be back. Thank you Anna & your husband for this business and Laura for my beautiful massage.

showerReviews.reviewText: Absolutely Devine...from the moment we entered reception we were greeted by Tina & shown to the waiting area...we had a glass of water & lavender tea...once we were shown to our floatation room Tina explained everything to us & we were on our way to pure relaxation...once we finished our hour float we showered ,& washed our hair with products that smelt & felt amazing...we left Blue Lagoon feeling relaxed & revived...Clean, professional & very serene atmosphere...I would highly recommend a visit by yourself or with a friend ! showerReviews.reviewText: Awful experience. Booked in for a facial & was really looking forward to it after a busy week. Laid down on the table & got under the towel when I felt dampness..top & bottom. The towels weren't dry. The lovely therapist Nora quickly offered to get new ones...but...they too were damp & musty. Bacteria & Mould would love these towels. Unfortunately Nora wasn't able to find any dry ones, they were all in the same state so I got dressed & headed out to request a refund. Unfortunately the Manager Alyssia was no help. She could not offer a refund & after speaking with the owner said I needed to call Customer Service to arrange it. Very poor form  from Alyssia & the owner to put the entire responsibility of the refund back in the hands of a very disappointed client. All the manger could do was repeat 'Im sorry there's nothing I can do, you'll have to ring Customers Service' when the polite, helpful & understanding therapist Nora came into the room & promptly arranged a cash refund. It took her less than 2 minutes so I am left wondering why it wasn't done I the first place. I might have accepted it was an unfortunate first experience & rebooked for another time but after the frustration of Alyssia & the owner, I won't be going back. There are so many far more professional  places, without damp musty towels, where I can spend my money. So disappointing.
showerReviews.author: L H

locations.title: Eassa Day Spa
locations.address: ÓÉà34 Hindley St, Adelaide SA 5000

showerReviews.reviewText:
UPDATE:
I recently returned for a facial and massage. First off, they did not tell me that the therapist for the massage and facial would be different. The massage therapist had a cold and was sniffling through the whole session. It was very disconcerting. Secondly, the beauty therapist was extremely rough with the facial. She did ask me twice if she should be more gentle and I said ‚Äúyes‚Äù but it was still the most rough facial that I have had. I have downgraded my review from 3‚≠êÔ∏è to 1‚≠êÔ∏è - you pay for what you get.

==================================

Firstly, this is not a luxury day spa. However, with the way cost of living is going, self care needs to fit a budget. The spa is clean and neat. I had a 60-min massage and a detox and deep clean facial. Whilst the beds are not as comfortable as luxury day spas and the towels are like those from a motel, my therapist Frantine was 5-stars.

It is on the rare occasion that one would come across a therapist who is equally good in massaging as well as the facial. Frantine has the highly sought after ‚Äúmagic hands‚Äù. The pressure for the massage was perfect as was her technique during the facial. Due to her skill and talent alone, it has bumped what would have been 2-stars to 3-stars.

The minus points were:
1) No offer of water or tea on arrival
2) I was told to go to the 2nd floor - the place has 2 mezzanines and it‚Äôs confusing
3) uncomfortable beds
4) the bolster placed under the knees is very thin
5) scrappy old and thin towels that are not too small - they should use bath sheets
6) no offer of water or tea at the end of the treatment
7) the equipment was dragged from the room whilst I was dosing off during the mask-portion of my facial which woke me up.

Even so, for Frantine‚Äôs skill, I would return for another massage and facial.
showerReviews.author: Mi Ro

showerReviews.reviewText:
UPDATE:
I recently returned for a facial and massage. First off, they did not tell me that the therapist for the massage and facial would be different. The massage therapist had a cold and was sniffling through the whole session. It was very disconcerting. Secondly, the beauty therapist was extremely rough with the facial. She did ask me twice if she should be more gentle and I said ‚Äúyes‚Äù but it was still the most rough facial that I have had. I have downgraded my review from 3‚≠êÔ∏è to 1‚≠êÔ∏è - you pay for what you get.

==================================

Firstly, this is not a luxury day spa. However, with the way cost of living is going, self care needs to fit a budget. The spa is clean and neat. I had a 60-min massage and a detox and deep clean facial. Whilst the beds are not as comfortable as luxury day spas and the towels are like those from a motel, my therapist Frantine was 5-stars.

It is on the rare occasion that one would come across a therapist who is equally good in massaging as well as the facial. Frantine has the highly sought after ‚Äúmagic hands‚Äù. The pressure for the massage was perfect as was her technique during the facial. Due to her skill and talent alone, it has bumped what would have been 2-stars to 3-stars.

The minus points were:
1) No offer of water or tea on arrival
2) I was told to go to the 2nd floor - the place has 2 mezzanines and it‚Äôs confusing
3) uncomfortable beds
4) the bolster placed under the knees is very thin
5) scrappy old and thin towels that are not too small - they should use bath sheets
6) no offer of water or tea at the end of the treatment
7) the equipment was dragged from the room whilst I was dosing off during the mask-portion of my facial which woke me up.

Even so, for Frantine‚Äôs skill, I would return for another massage and facial.
showerReviews.author: Mi Ro

locations.title: Blue Lagoon Float and Spa Hyde Park
locations.address: ÓÉà132 King William Rd, Goodwood SA 5061

showerReviews.reviewText:
Blue Lagoon North Adelaide Review

My daughter and I visited Blue Lagoon North Adelaide for a hair spa experience, and it was a delightful treat. The warm welcome and soothing tea in the waiting area set a lovely tone. The hair spa itself, complete with a neck massage, luxury shampoo, and conditioner, was a solid experience, well worth the $99 for 30 minutes. The blow-dry room was thoughtfully equipped with all necessary hair care products, and the second cup of invigorating tea was a nice touch. The staff's professionalism and the exit service were commendable, making us feel truly valued.

To elevate the experience further, a few tweaks could make a big difference. The ambient room was beautiful, but loud water piping occasionally disrupted the calm. Swapping the small towel over the eyes for a nourishing eye treatment on cotton pads would enhance comfort and add a luxurious touch. Additionally, relocating the blow-dry room away from the staff room could minimise interruptions and create a more private, relaxing space. From a sales perspective, showcasing the divine shampoo and conditioner for purchase would be a fantastic upsell opportunity. Lastly, clearer signage on level 2 near the restaurant would make finding the salon much easier, especially for newcomers.

Overall, Blue Lagoon offers a wonderful experience with a few opportunities to polish an already great service. We'll definitely be back!
showerReviews.author: Anna Andreoni

showerReviews.reviewText:
My 30-minute float at Blue Lagoon Float and Spa Hyde Park was amazing‚Äîhonestly, it saved me the airfare to the Dead Sea! The feeling of weightlessness was exactly how I imagine floating in space. The underwater speaker was a great touch, as my ears were submerged, and the sounds were calming. I did ask about more nature sounds beyond ocean waves, but options were limited‚Äîsomething to consider for future playlists! Having the water spray handy was an eye saver when you accidently get a bit of water in your eyes when getting the hang of it.

Everything needed for the float was within reach, and the staff member‚Äôs explanation was clear and helpful. However, just as she was doing a great job setting the peaceful atmosphere, two other staff members giggling down the corridor briefly interrupted the serenity. Not a huge deal, but a little distracting in what‚Äôs meant to be an ultra-relaxing uber premium experience.

The 30-minute infrared sauna was also a highlight! The dry heat was great, and the controls were super easy to adjust. Being 6ft tall, I could sit comfortably but couldn‚Äôt lie down, which I usually like in larger traditional saunas. The biggest surprise? A damp towel‚Äîon a 37-degree day! The staff mentioned they were having trouble drying them, which seemed ironic given the weather. Not a deal breaker, but definitely a small fix that would improve the experience.

Overall, it‚Äôs a great place to try floating, especially with their affordable entry level deals. A few small touches‚Äîmore sound choices, a bit more staff awareness, and dry towels‚Äîand this would be an easy 5-star experience. I can absolutely see why, this is a 5-star spot for many people. I‚Äôll definitely be back (maybe with my own towel, just in case)! üòÜ
showerReviews.author: Daniel

showerReviews.reviewText:
I cannot speak highly enough of my experience at this gym. From the moment I walked in, I was impressed by the cleanliness and professionalism of the staff. The facility is immaculately maintained, with state-of-the-art equipment and pristine workout areas.

The staff members are friendly, knowledgeable, and always willing to assist with any questions or concerns. It's clear that they take pride in providing a top-notch experience for their members.

The cleanliness standards at this gym are unparalleled. The equipment is regularly sanitized, and I always feel comfortable using it. The locker rooms and showers are spotless, which is a refreshing change from other gyms I've visited.

Overall, I would highly recommend this gym to anyone looking for a clean, safe, and welcoming environment to achieve their fitness goals. It's a true gem in the fitness community, and I look forward to continuing my membership for years to come!

showerReviews.reviewText:
The staff were friendly and knowledgeable. It was amazing to think that this was once the town's rubbish tip! 6 years and tons of rubbish removed by the local Lions Club has made it into a great tourist attraction.
If you are a certified cave diver, there is actually over 230m of tunnels running under the highway. The water is crystal clear and looks about a foot deep when in fact it is 7meters!
There are LOTS of steps, so no wheelchair access, and you need to be relatively ambulant.
There is a gift shop, amenities and ample street parking.
You are requested to pre-purchase your tickets via a QR code on the board out the front! The very lovely lady did it for us at the desk.
showerReviews.author: jilly beanz

locations.title: The Commodore
locations.address: ÓÉàCnr Jubillee Highway and, Penola Rd, Mount Gambier SA 5290

showerReviews.reviewText: This accommodation was for a work trip so I wasn't here long or for a getaway. I would say the location is central which is handy, the staff were helpful and friendly. The restaurant didn't have the biggest menu and was quite expensive. Example, $12 for a bottle of sparkling water and $50 for a dozen oysters. The rooms are on the smaller side with not much moving around room. The second double bed seems like a waste. The shower is also packed in a corner with the shower head opposite the door and above the tap handle, meaning you would open the door, reach in and turn on the shower and then get sprayed in the face, as water blasts out into the bathroom space. The water would also go from set temperature to boiling hot to freezing cold (must have been affected by others showering at the same time). The wifi kept dropping out which also affected the Foxtel on the tv (would have been a good option to the the ability for streaming services). Coming back to the room from a long day of work, it would have been nice to be able to have a decent shower, sit, watch tv and scroll. Also whilst there were mugs in the room, it would have been great to have some bowls. The laundry service advertised was a coin washing machine and dryer (having more then one machine and the ability to pay by card would have been a great option). It was ok, I just wouldn't recommend the commodore to anyone looking for a spacious, comfortable option on their travels, maybe a stay where you don't intend to spend too much time at the accommodation.
showerReviews.author: Chris Chapman

showerReviews.reviewText:
My friend booked a night for group of 12.
12 of of us got bed. They arranged rooms very well and affordable. Plenty of sealed blankets, towels, bedsheets. Everything was super clean. The motel look after us very well.
We really enjoyed our stay. Receptionist was friendly with kids providing the soccer balls.
Our previous stay at presidential motel was super expensive comparing limestone is far better.
showerReviews.author: paulraj marichamy

showerReviews.reviewText: Not happy with our stay here at $200 a night, booked for 3 nights as we had a funeral and are from interstate.. left after one night, lost our $400 as office closed all day on Sunday so not able to discuss our situation, it was our choice to leave as we found a nicer place! The area at the front for people with their own vans was nice to arrive at but up the back where we were was far from that. Fortunately we found a beautiful property called 'Pet Friendly Cottages' (they had a cancellation for two nights) in Worrolong which was just perfect in every way, the whole property was so inviting, heater on for us on arrival, very cosy for us and our dog Monty. Goodies in the house that we enjoyed,  owners Russell and Pauline.. so so friendly you couldn't have asked for any more. Definately dog friendly and you couldn't compare to where we first booked and stayed. We found it via my sister in law who lives in Mt Gambier. Open space, country feel, small lockable yard for Monty the dog to be in and safe.The cabin (Limestone Coast) under this review WAS clean, bed comfy with electric blanket, but cold and uninviting. We booked 3 nights, stayed one and lost $400. Charged $200 a night but looking now on website it says $133.00 a night..not sure why extra cost, maybe because of the rodeo and sporting weekend there,   all dog friendly was booked out! We were up the back of the park in a cabin no. 5. We had a small dog. It wasn't pet friendly, it was pets welcome!!! There was no yard or area at all for a dog. We were up the back where it was quite unkept. What little lawn there was, was unmowed. It was 4 rooms in a square box, website deceiving, looked much nicer and bigger than ours was. A small porch, a lounge come bedroom/double bunk/couch/tv room, all in one. No cupboards or shelves in the bathroom to put essentials in or on, so all items on the floor. No wardrobe, a small unit on the wall with 2 coat hangers for our clothes, that was it had to live out of our cases that could only go on the bunks in the lounge/bedroom. Kitchen small but usable, all utensils and crockery old and well used. Shower awful, no water pressure in the shower or hot tap over the sink. Shower water ran hot and cold, hard to adjust then just went cold. There was no lighting outside our cabin so thank goodness we had a torch to take the dog for a walk before his bedtime. I saw a couple of reviews and wondered if it was the same part of the park we were in. We have no caravan to travel with, so rely on the website to be accurate. We've travelled a lot, over the years and mostly with a dog but never not stayed in the places we had booked on line.  Unfortunately this isn't a nice place to have stayed and i think their ratings for some or all the cabins up the back should be reviewed....
showerReviews.author: Elwyn Heald

locations.address: ÓÉàLOT 100 Bay Rd, Mount Gambier SA 5290

showerReviews.reviewText: We had a lovely 6 days in this park. The park itself is beautifully maintained, and is also surrounded by beautiful scenery. The Sites are nice and spacious, even when the park was full you didn‚Äôt feel crammed on top of your neighbours like some parks in peak season. Very well maintained facilities, plenty of toilets and showers - no wait for a shower in the morning. Kids swam for hours in the indoor pool with waterslide. Most importantly the staff were very helpful,  friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend this park!
showerReviews.author: Andrea McCarthy

showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely location, just about a 100m walk away from Blue Lake and the rest of Mr Gambier is close by too.
I loved the indoor pool and the water slides, me and my little sister had a blast! Also extremely convenient how close all the amenities were to each other!
But, we were camping there in a tent at site 31, but there was a massive dry patch with no grass there! I get that caravans usually stay at powered sites, but please still try to maintain your grass!
Another issue is the camp kitchen. I understand how it‚Äôs a small Big4 Holiday Park, but the kitchen was tiny, with only 1 sink and oven! Also it was extremely crowded around meal times, so it was hard to prepare food and enjoy it in some sort of peace! I highly recommend fixing this issue, and as soon as possible!
But other than that everything was wonderful :)
showerReviews.author: Minh N

showerReviews.reviewText: We were looking for a caravan park and once we arrived we were so very pleasantly surprised. The caravan park is the best we have been to and the staff and the amenities were spot on. We had an ensuited caravan site which was modern and spotless and a very spacious site for our large van. They are continually adding and updating the park so the kids who stay can really enjoy the heated undercover pool, pickle ball court and the bike track. Plenty of walking tracks with Valley Lake and the incredible Blue Lake at your door step.This park is a must , highly recommend.
showerReviews.author: Julie Ford

Good value for money also, so would definitely recommend.

showerReviews.reviewText:
The park seems to have been recently bought and the new owners are just finding their feet .
The cabin was clean and water pressure was great . The reverse cycle aircon worked great . We found the beds hard but linens were clean and fresh . There's no hand towels in bathroom .
The park needed a good gardner , as it was overgrown and scruffy looking .
Staff were friendly and helpful , we will definitely book here again , and see how the new owners are progressing .

showerReviews.reviewText:
Most expensive at $55 / night for our first ever ensuite  powered site. Web says 40/50 for off peak/peak.  This was def off peak but charged premium End Aug 2025. Not sure why.
Worst shower out of many many caravan parks. Checked other ensuite and also just a dribble - thats a dribble not exageration. They could have the same volume thru a diff head and maybe ok, if water is premium.
Owners may respond with - you could have told us before review but when cold and early o'clock the last thing I wanted to do is hunt around and find someone to say the shower is abysmal knowing they would not be able to fix it anyway. And they would know, they made them that way.
On a +ve note they do seem to be trying to tidy the place up. Maybe they will get around to the showers in ensuite.
Justin
showerReviews.author: Justin Richards

showerReviews.reviewText:
This motel was extremely disappointing. The room was in poor condition and did not appear to be properly cleaned before arrival. There were clear hygiene issues, and the overall environment felt uncomfortable and neglected.

The facilities were outdated and poorly maintained, with several things not functioning as expected. For the price charged, the quality of the accommodation was far below an acceptable standard.

Customer service was also unsatisfactory. Staff were unhelpful and showed little willingness to address concerns or take responsibility.

Overall, this stay did not meet even basic expectations. I would not recommend this motel to others.

Personally, I didn‚Äôt feel safe - we had a self titled homeless girl ask for a towel to shower (which she was given), people screaming at each other on the other side of the fence, and sirens for most of the stay. Amenities clean and park is centrally located, but not one we would go back to.

locations.title: Admella Reserve
locations.address: ÓÉàCarpenter Rocks SA 5291

showerReviews.reviewText:
Very close to the beach and within walking distance to the tavern as well as general store. If you're keen you can even walk to the lighthouse via the road or beach.

It's a massive wide open area so can get pretty windy and even though there is one single unisex toilet (cleaned daily) it can be a bit of a hike to reach it.
No showers but there is a BBQ and picnic area, a tennis/basketball court and a children's play area. They also have a bike/skate ramp.
There is also a dumppoint and one rainwater tank.
Fuel is available near the general store 24 hours using prepaid credit card.
showerReviews.author: Emmy Silvius

Never slept in a prison cell before (;

Location is great and super close to the city centre.

If busy, could be like any YHA or caravan park and waiting could be involved. With no ensuites, is a cold walk outside to use facilities, need appropriate cover. Can self tour the entire complex, has a range of information panels. Very quiet overnight. Plenty of off street parking. Easy walk to shops.

showerReviews.reviewText:
Great view and lots to do for the kids in this caravan park. Our site was right on the waterfront.

Large swimming pool with lots of shade available, splash park, bike pump track, jumping pillow and playground. The splash park looks quite faded so could be due for an update.
Plenty of stuff to hire on the lake too like stand up paddle boards, paddle boats and kayaks. Also water trampolines set up all the time.

The website says family facilities but I don‚Äôt believe a plastic baby bath on a bench is exactly a ‚Äúfamily facility‚Äù. Definitely needs a parent room where the family can go in to make bathing a little one more convenient. Even a block with a couple larger stalls big enough for parents and child with a bath shower combo would be beneficial to families. We had our 5 month old and would have liked if this was available to us.

Caravan park was a short walk to Main Street and another playground and cafe.

Enjoyed our stay.

showerReviews.reviewText:
As I mentioned, the 2-metre-plus security fence immediately put me off ‚Äî not my style at all.

We booked what was described as a standard motel room (sleeps 3), which typically means a queen bed and a single. Instead, we were given what appeared to be the overflow children‚Äôs annex from a double family room ‚Äî three single beds crammed into a space that had clearly been retrofitted to pass as a separate room. It felt like a makeshift solution that children might tolerate, but discerning adults would find quite underwhelming.

The bathroom was a mixed bag. While the individually provided shampoo, conditioner, and body wash were a nice touch, the shower drainage was poorly designed ‚Äî water pooled directly in front of the toilet rather than flowing to the drain. The sliding door wouldn‚Äôt close properly, and the exhaust fan above the shower was in a filthy, unacceptable state.

On the upside, the beds were reasonably comfortable. But the air conditioning and the curtains were significantly skewed, and while not critical, these details reflect a broader neglect in how the room is maintained and presented.

To my knowledge, there was no iron, no hairdryer, and the cleaning gear ‚Äî broom, mop, etc. ‚Äî was piled in the corner next to an uncomfortable wooden chair, adding to the general feeling of being in a utility closet rather than a guest room.

These are, of course, my personal impressions and others may feel differently. That said, I had no hesitation in giving 5-star reviews to both hotels we stayed at on either side of this visit ‚Äî and both of those were older properties, likely dating from the 1980s, and at a lower price point. So I don‚Äôt believe I‚Äôm especially hard to please ‚Äî just someone who expects a room to reflect what was promised
showerReviews.author: James McKay

The bathroom was a mixed bag. While the individually provided shampoo, conditioner, and body wash were a nice touch, the shower drainage was poorly designed ‚Äî water pooled directly in front of the toilet rather than flowing to the drain. The sliding door wouldn‚Äôt close properly, and the exhaust fan above the shower was in a filthy, unacceptable state.

On the upside, the beds were reasonably comfortable. But the air conditioning and the curtains were significantly skewed, and while not critical, these details reflect a broader neglect in how the room is maintained and presented.

To my knowledge, there was no iron, no hairdryer, and the cleaning gear ‚Äî broom, mop, etc. ‚Äî was piled in the corner next to an uncomfortable wooden chair, adding to the general feeling of being in a utility closet rather than a guest room.

These are, of course, my personal impressions and others may feel differently. That said, I had no hesitation in giving 5-star reviews to both hotels we stayed at on either side of this visit ‚Äî and both of those were older properties, likely dating from the 1980s, and at a lower price point. So I don‚Äôt believe I‚Äôm especially hard to please ‚Äî just someone who expects a room to reflect what was promised
showerReviews.author: James McKay

The beds and pillows were quite firm which didn't suit my Son but I found it acceptable, and it did not interfere with my sleep quality.
A rare feature of the shower is a proper shower screen, excellent. We had an issue with the shower head where the water came out like a waterfall, which I reported to the reception and was given a new one which worked perfectly. Why don't people report these issues so they can be fixed?
Has a nice location and almost everything in town is between 4‚Äì6-minute drive.
Definitely stay here again the next time we come down to the Mount.

locations.title: The Lodge by Abode Accommodations
locations.address: ÓÉà92 Riddoch Hwy, Mount Gambier SA 5290

showerReviews.reviewText:
A truly stylish and comfortable accommodation.
Comfort, cleanliness, price, service, style are all 5 star.
The pro's
No stairs, great parking. Everything you would expect to find in a motel room plus iron, microwave, crockery & cutlery for two, Nespresso coffee maker, small dining table, good sized fridge, smart TV that is rotatable, games room with vending machine, hair dryer and smart lock.
Zoe is personable and well organised, check in and out was completed with ease.
The cons
Mount Gambier's water supply comes from the blue lake and is naturally filtered through limestone. I found the taste not to my liking. The lodge supplied 2 small bottles of water, however for extended stays I would recommend taking an extra bottle or two.
The shower is an overhead rain shower (beautiful), a shower cap is required if you're not wanting to wash your hair.
Thank you so much Zoe, I will definitely be back
showerReviews.author: Lorena Ferdinands

showerReviews.reviewText:
My recent stay at the Pooraka Motor Inn in Adelaide was unfortunately quite disappointing, particularly given the cost of over $1000 for the week. This was my first visit to Adelaide, and I had anticipated a more positive experience.

A significant issue throughout my stay was the persistent noise disturbances. Despite multiple signs around the property requesting quiet after 10 PM, I was repeatedly subjected to loud arguments and screaming from a neighboring room, presumably occupied by a long-term resident and her children. These disturbances often extended well past midnight and continued into the early hours of subsequent mornings, severely impacting our ability to rest.

Furthermore, the in-room amenities were unsatisfactory. The milk pods provided in the refrigerator were expired as of December 9, 2024, which I only discovered after consuming most of my coffee and finding curdled milk at the bottom of the cup. The bed and pillows were also notably uncomfortable, feeling exceptionally hard.

On a positive note, the motel's proximity to my friend's residence and the availability of free parking were convenient. However, these minor benefits do not outweigh the overall poor experience. For the price paid, my expectations for comfort and a peaceful environment were not met.

Given these concerns, I would not recommend the Pooraka Motor Inn and will seek alternative accommodation for any future visits to Adelaide.
showerReviews.author: Rebecca Kerr

showerReviews.reviewText:
Horrendous in almost every possible way.
Firstly the current renovation....the info on the website contradicts itself, is lacking in firm information about re-opening. Call up and ask about it and you get a really nasty woman who talks over you, interrupts to shut you down to tell you nothing.
The lockers which you pay for rarely work and this has been going on for years....why don't you fix them instead of expecting people to traipse back to reception to try another key????
The music played during water exercise classes in the main 25m pool is horrendously load...why should the other fee paying swimmers have to suffer it...put your head under water and you can still hear it. This is auditory abuse. It's almost certainly way above safe sound levels for a public space. If you don't fix it by next time I visit, I am sure I can arrange for Safework SA to visit and measure the sound level.....just try me. Management are not treating people fairly by allowing this...and it's also been going on for years. Never ever encountered this in any other indoor pool anywhere else, so why the hell is this acceptable here?
All in all the ratepayers of the region are not being treated properly by the terrible management of this pool. A place which cost a fortune to build and no doubt run, which could be fantastic but the incredibly poor management obviously hasn't changed or improved since opening. GET YOUR ACT TOGETHER. GET THE BLOODY TILES STUCK TO THE 25M POOL WITHOUT FURTHER DELAY AND FIRE YOUR MANAGERS.
showerReviews.author: MDG

showerReviews.reviewText: The Fleurieu Aquatic Centre is an asset to the region! I have been an "Active Adults" member for around six years and visit twice a week to swim laps. The pools, change rooms and other areas are sparkling clean and well appointed. At the time of day I visit, (around 3pm) I usually have a lane all to myself. After my laps, I like to relax in the therapeutic pool for a while, enjoying the soothing water jets and warm temperature. My membership includes use of the gym, which is also very well appointed. The membership entitles us to regular personal health and fitness assessments, with a tailored workout plan. Then, there are the many classes which cater for all exercise levels and tastes. While I mostly swim laps, it is great to know I have access to an entire range of exercise options - and all for a very reasonable membership fee. Staff are unfailingly friendly and polite, always greeting you with a smile. The coffee shop offers a selection of delicious sweet and savoury snacks, while the coffee can compete with the best in town. I can't recommend the centre highly enough and feel grateful that we have such a world class facility on our doorstep!
showerReviews.author: Christa Michaelis

showerReviews.reviewText: The Fleurieu Aquatic Centre is an asset to the region! I have been an "Active Adults" member for around six years and visit twice a week to swim laps. The pools, change rooms and other areas are sparkling clean and well appointed. At the time of day I visit, (around 3pm) I usually have a lane all to myself. After my laps, I like to relax in the therapeutic pool for a while, enjoying the soothing water jets and warm temperature. My membership includes use of the gym, which is also very well appointed. The membership entitles us to regular personal health and fitness assessments, with a tailored workout plan. Then, there are the many classes which cater for all exercise levels and tastes. While I mostly swim laps, it is great to know I have access to an entire range of exercise options - and all for a very reasonable membership fee. Staff are unfailingly friendly and polite, always greeting you with a smile. The coffee shop offers a selection of delicious sweet and savoury snacks, while the coffee can compete with the best in town. I can't recommend the centre highly enough and feel grateful that we have such a world class facility on our doorstep!
showerReviews.author: Christa Michaelis

There are also outside water play areas and a hydrotherapy pool which I haven't checked out yet.  The kids love swimming here as low probability of sunburn or jelly fish. üòâ  Some snacks and refreshments available at times including coffee, ice creams and hot chips.

locations.title: Granite Island Recreation Park
locations.address: ÓÉàCJPM+CW, 1 Granite Island Rd, Victor Harbor SA 5211

showerReviews.reviewText:
We absolutely loved our visit to Granite Island! It‚Äôs such a beautiful and unique place with stunning coastal views all the way around. The walk across the causeway is really special, especially if you‚Äôre lucky enough to see the horse-drawn tram in action ‚Äî it adds so much charm.

The island‚Äôs walking trail is easy to follow and offers amazing scenery ‚Äî dramatic cliffs, interesting rock formations, and plenty of spots to stop and take photos. We enjoyed watching the waves crash against the rocks and even spotted some seals swimming nearby!

It‚Äôs also great to know that Granite Island is home to a little penguin colony ‚Äî even though they‚Äôre shy during the day, it‚Äôs lovely to see how much care goes into protecting them.

The facilities are basic but good, with a caf√© and information signs along the track. I‚Äôd recommend wearing comfy shoes and bringing a jacket ‚Äî it can get windy!

Granite Island is a must-visit if you‚Äôre in Victor Harbor ‚Äî a perfect mix of nature, wildlife, and local history. We can‚Äôt wait to come back!
showerReviews.author: natali nata

locations.title: McCracken Resort
locations.address: ÓÉàMcCracken Dr, Victor Harbor SA 5211

showerReviews.reviewText: The hotel has modern and attractive rooms with everything you need: kettle, microwave, iron, and hairdryer. Large bathroom with shower and jacuzzi. You can have either a continental or an excellent full English breakfast. You can also play golf here. I highly recommend it.
showerReviews.author: EneaS17

showerReviews.reviewText: The hotel has modern and attractive rooms with everything you need: kettle, microwave, iron, and hairdryer. Large bathroom with shower and jacuzzi. You can have either a continental or an excellent full English breakfast. You can also play golf here. I highly recommend it.
showerReviews.author: EneaS17

showerReviews.reviewText: Stayed here for a mid week mini break after winning a $200 voucher through SA travel incentive. Had reception call me at work (3) days prior to our arrival virtually demanding the remaining $58 to be paid in full straight away. I asked why I couldn't use the credit card they already had on my file to pay on my arrival like most respected hotels. Was told that it had to be paid up straight away. I advised them I was at work and it was a Sunday. I only had access to Google wallet on my mobile which was not enough for them. So they resorted to calling my wife who was away on business interstate to have her pay immediately. On arrival the receptionist was wanting us to move our car from the drop of pick up point outside the front door. I literally was still holding my bags I had just unloaded to take to our room. The room was OK. Large and a bit sparse. Rock hard beds. Advertised swimming pool had a broken heater, so was cold, obviously no one swimming around in it. Sign said would be a couple of weeks to get fixed. Other guests stated the pool had been broken for over a month. Had a great first night in the dinning area and bar. Food was OK. Spent about $300 and met some new friends. Went to sleep for a good night's rest and a well deserved lay in due to being away from home and off from work. Woken at 8.00 am to the sound of Jack hammering next to our room in the stair-well. Hotel was having some flooring Reno's. This very loud jack hammering with the terrible vibrations throughout the room ruined any chance of a peaceful romantic getaway. This went on non stop for 3 hours. Unable to even make a phone call as it felt like I was on the front line in Afghanistan during a conflict. Complained, respectfully to reception who said they would have the manager call me as they were in a meeting. Manager called a couple of hours later. Extremely dismissive of the situation, stating it was only a short disturbance (3 hours short, until we decided to get out of the hotel to save our hearing). Manager said she was sorry for our inconvenience. Absolutely no attempt to rectify the situation or make some form of peace offering. I explained that it would of been wise to perhaps not book the rooms out around the building works for obvious reasons. Manager stated that they would have had to shut the whole wing down and they were not prepared to do that. I explained that it may have been a little more professional to prepare the guests for that type of site works then the guests could decide if they would stay or not and even be prepared by bringing some ear defenders. Manager advised that they had some at reception. I figured the manager was over the call and just seemed to be belittling me and the situation. Very poor behaviours from the manager at what should be a great resort / hotel in a beautiful part of our State. I would recommend some further customer service trainingfor front line staff and the manager. Obviously we are not happy with our overall experience. Yes we had a SA state voucher to use, but we could have used it at any of the other available places to stay. Pretty sure the hotels get paid or some form of kick back for those type of vouchers. Felt like we were treated like people who were not worthy of staying at McCracken Country Resort.
showerReviews.author: Phillip Rundle

locations.title: Pan Co Victor Harbor
locations.address: ÓÉà2 Victoria St, Victor Harbor SA 5211

showerReviews.reviewText: Booked last minute at booking.com for great value. Easy self check-in with door code, decent size and meticulously clean rooms. I asked for a double bed rather than a twin room and received a king.  Lovely amenities with free organic shampoo, conditioner, body wash. Modern well thought furnishings and  decor throughout the room and bath. Bathroom was a bit dated but do not mind in the slightest as incredibly clean with lovely touches inc hair dryer, folded towels etc. A bbq for use with outdoor cafe tables for leisure, make a nice touch. On-site laundry for a nominal fee. A thoroughly comfortable, well serviced motel an easy walk to all of Victor central, it's cafes, pubs, beach and Granite Island. Their compendium found in room has a wonderful list of local eateries and menus. Don't overlook this quaint motel. Thoroughly recommend.
showerReviews.author: Mandy Ponton

We stayed for one night at this property and we were so happy.
Jane and Geoff are amazing hosts.
Our room was very spacious. It had 2x Queen beds and they were very comfortable.
The room was very clean and had everything we could have needed.
The shower was nice and hot and the water pressure was great.
We would not hesitate to come back for a longer stay. It is in a great location within walking distance to most attractions and being in the Main Street it was close to restaurants and hotels as well as supermarkets. There was no traffic noise and we had a great night sleep.
We would highly recommend this property.

The short walk to the Whalers Seaside Dining was well worth it with a great range and what we ordered was all solid eating.
The only downside is there is no room service at the apartments however if you're not expecting it then it's no problem. The concierge was pleasant and efficient.
Overall the 2 night stay was a pleasant visit and good value overall.

showerReviews.reviewText:
My partner and I booked Wirrina Cove, unpowered site for one night to get away from the hustle and bustle. The location is amazing, you really feel like you‚Äôre deep in the bush however only an hour from Adelaide! When we arrived, we were unable to find anyone in reception (around 2pm) or get them on the after hours number so we just found our spot based on our online booking and set up for the night, we didn‚Äôt see the owners around after arriving so I assume this was okay! The grass was green and generally well kept. The renovated bathrooms were tidy and clean. Lots of wildlife and kangaroos around and one of the only holiday parks in the south that you are able to bring dogs AND have a fire. We enjoyed our stay and will be back.
The reception was closed and looked to be that way for some time, there were no supplies visible and the camp kitchen was a little run down, however we don‚Äôt rely on it so didn‚Äôt need to use it! This may be different in the warmer months! We went to the coffee van on Sunday morning for a coffee, however no one opened up following the open times on the board. Overall, enjoyed our night and will be back!
showerReviews.author: Drew Lewis

showerReviews.reviewText:
The hotel is located on McKenzie street Ceduna. Almost 9 hours drive from Adelaide.

In relation to hotel, the rooms are well maintained and has swimming pool as well. The room which I stayed was okay and I would say it is ideal for couples. The room has little space but was okay. One thing I really annoyed by beds. Beds are too much wobbling. You even canst sit properly. If you sit, beds will move here and there.

There is swimming pool but it isn‚Äôt maintained properly. You will insects and wasps swimming in the pool as you can see in the video.

You will see OTR near the hotel so it‚Äôs convenient. Apart from this there is nothing else. You will get Indian cuisine in the hotel but from 5 to 9 only.

Overall, I had good experience. It is cheap and good place to stay if you are driving to Ceduna. For now I am giving them two stars because of swimming pool. I hope they maintain and improve their quality and service.

showerReviews.reviewText:
I recently stayed at your hotel and unfortunately found the room in need of significant improvement. The property itself appears very old and in great need of renovation. The shower taps were confusing, with the hot and cold indicators reversed, and the water temperature could only be regulated by turning both taps on together. The sink splashback had blood stains left behind from a previous guest, which was very concerning. The lights above the bed could not be switched on as there was no visible switch, and the air conditioning was stuck on one setting ‚Äì warm only ‚Äì making the room warmer than outside, yet still uncomfortably cold.

Given the price charged per night, I expected a much better standard. I hope you can address these issues to improve the experience for future guests.
showerReviews.author: louise bruno wood

showerReviews.reviewText: Recently stayed in a powered site. The park is very well maintained and all amenities and the camp kitchen kept spotless and in good condition. The caravan sites are spacious and the use of hedges and plants around each site provides privacy. There were a lot of extra features to keep both adults and kids entertained. The staff were friendly and helpful. The christmas decorations spread throughout the park added to the festive atmosphere. This was the most well maintained and clean park we have stayed in.

showerReviews.reviewText: This place is wonderful. Very well maintained, friendly staff. Cabin was immaculate, had great views of the lake from verandah, which was undercover. Had everything that was needed. There was milk in the fridge, tea, coffee and sugar plus fresh roasted ground coffee. Very comfortable beds, extra bedding and towels and towels for use in the swimming pool, also good quality toiletries supplied. The cabin was airconditioned but also had a portable heater/cooler in the bedrooms plus electric blankets. Good quality kitchen appliances and equipment. The swimming pool was lovely and had a shade over it, crazy golf was well maintained and there was a large chess board. I can't think of anything bad to say about Discovery Park Hahndorf.
showerReviews.author: Anne Comer

showerReviews.reviewText: We are in the middle of our extended stay at Hahndorf and I must say WOW we have been on the road now for close to 3 years and this is one of if not the best parks we have stayed in. showerReviews.reviewText:
Lovely hotel to stay a night, I had just finished a five day hike and walked in buggered, hoping for a hot shower and cosy bed, the lady that managers the restaurant area was very friendly and made me feel welcomed. The staff in the cafe were also friendly and I felt welcomed but I was a little bit at a lose with the lady that helped me with my room, I'm not sure why people don't smile and welcome you when they work in this industry ( maybe she was having a bad day), but thank you to the lovely restaurant manager she made my afternoon so much better, I wish l could remember her name.
Oh and the room was nice, hot water took a long time to come on lol but I was willing to wait üòÜ

showerReviews.reviewText:
Update:   I had written my review on the first night staying at the Night Cap and had used my room's amenities e.g Monsoon shower, heating etc  which were both excellent  and the room was clean.

I went down to dinner and the food was great.

Unfortunately my room was next to the main entrance part of the hallway which led to the  rooms of the hotel,  so I heard noise throughout the night and early in the morning there was a fire alarm, so we all had to leave the building, some of us left our room in our pyjamas, the firebrigade came at some point and there seemed to be no fire.

I have updated my 5 star rating to 3 stars mostly because the staff did not communicate very much about what was going on during the fire safety evacuation procedures - because there was no staff initially, the guests had to evacuate by themselves initially, and some of us stood outside in the cold in our pyjamas waiting for the staff to arrive. When the staff eventually did, they didn't say alot. The guests had to ask probing questions to get any communication out of the staff.

It should be understood by the staff that the guests are concerned for their belongings when these fire evacuation procedures happen that is why guests want the staff to be proactive in communication and not expect the guests to initiate communication about the situation.

One of the guests told me this was there second fire alarm evacuation during their stay.

I may stay here again but a lot would have to improve, mainly soundproofing rooms or putting signs in the hallways telling guests not to yell and raise their voice in the hallways for the sake of other guests in their rooms and there would need to be an assurance of better fire safety training for their staff.

Due to this experience I do not think the rate is worth it, because the experience was stressful for a two night stay.

Earlier review: Superb food, friendly hotel and pub staff, clean rooms, great monsoon shower, worth  the hotel rate, and yes close to the harbour, galleries, cafes and shopping mall, and the historic Cockle train, if you are ever in the area or travelling around this area, it is worth a stay.
showerReviews.author: O N

showerReviews.reviewText: STAY AWAY!!!!! I get regular massages and this was HORRIBLE! She clearly has no training and she couldn't speak English. If she was good, that wouldn't matter so much. I wanted a dry massage and she kept pushing for oil. Eventually she gave up but still made me take my top off. This was not necessary. She didn't drape a towel over me and had no technique. Was like getting a back rub from a child, worse actually. At the end I had to transfer into their bank account which was weird. THEY NEED TO BE CLOSED.  ABSOLUTE ROBBERY!!!
